parameters.name: ctl_bw
parameters.longDesc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameters.name: ctl_dir
parameters.longDesc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameters.name: ctl_gain
parameters.longDesc:
Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller
            aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with
            higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased;
            systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain
            decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result
            in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a
            slower, smoother response.

parameters.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameters.longDesc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameters.name: ctl_start_rate
parameters.longDesc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameters.name: esc_index
parameters.shortDesc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameters.longDesc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameters.name: id_ext_status
parameters.longDesc: Extended status ID

parameters.name: int_ext_status
parameters.longDesc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameters.name: int_status
parameters.longDesc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameters.name: mot_i_max
parameters.longDesc:
Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum
            current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable
            current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to
            the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification
            sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power
            divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameters.name: mot_kv
parameters.shortDesc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameters.longDesc:
Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s
            specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but
            some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameters.name: mot_ls
parameters.shortDesc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameters.longDesc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameters.name: mot_num_poles
parameters.longDesc:
Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to
            electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s
            specification sheet.

parameters.name: mot_rs
parameters.shortDesc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameters.longDesc:
READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When
            tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal
            to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameters.name: mot_v_accel
parameters.longDesc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameters.name: mot_v_max
parameters.longDesc:
Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s
            commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may
            safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the
            actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the
            motor current limit.

parameters.name: gnss.dyn_model
parameters.longDesc:
Dynamic model used in the GNSS positioning engine. 0 –
        Automotive, 1 – Sea, 2 – Airborne.

parameters.name: gnss.old_fix_msg
parameters.longDesc:
Broadcast the old (deprecated) GNSS fix message
        uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix alongside the new alternative
        uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix2. It is recommended to
        disable this feature to reduce the CAN bus traffic.

parameters.name: gnss.warn_dimens
parameters.longDesc:
Set the device health to Warning if the dimensionality of
              the GNSS solution is less than this value. 3 for the full (3D)
              solution, 2 for planar (2D) solution, 1 for time-only solution,
              0 disables the feature.

parameters.name: gnss.warn_sats
parameters.longDesc:
Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites
        used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero
        disables the feature

parameters.name: uavcan.pubp-pres
parameters.longDesc:
Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites
        used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero
        disables the feature

parameters.name: PWM_MAIN_FUNC1
parameters.longDesc: Select what should be output on SIM Channel 1. The default failsafe value is set according to the selected function: - 'Min' for ConstantMin - 'Max' for ConstantMax - 'Max' for Parachute - ('Max'+'Min')/2 for Servos - 'Disarmed' for the rest

parameters.name: PWM_MAIN_REV
parameters.longDesc: Allows to reverse the output range for each channel. Note: this is only useful for servos.

parameters.name: ASPD_BETA_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed Selector: Gate size for sideslip angle fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: ASPD_BETA_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator sideslip measurement noise
parameters.longDesc: Sideslip measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameters.name: ASPD_DO_CHECKS
parameters.longDesc: Controls which checks are run to check airspeed data for validity. Only applied if ASPD_PRIMARY > 0. Note that the data missing check is enabled if any of the options is set.

bitmask.description: Only data missing check (triggers if more than 1s no data)
Data stuck (triggers if data is exactly constant for 2s in FW mode)
Load factor check (triggers if measurement is below stall speed)
Check for data variation in first 10s after sensor connection

parameters.name: ASPD_FALLBACK_GW
parameters.shortDesc: Enable fallback to sensor-less airspeed estimation
parameters.longDesc: If set to true and airspeed checks are enabled, it will use a sensor-less airspeed estimation based on groundspeed minus windspeed if no other airspeed sensor available to fall back to.

parameters.name: ASPD_FS_INNOV
parameters.longDesc: This specifies the minimum airspeed innovation required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller values make it more sensitive. Large innovations indicate an inconsistency between predicted (groundspeed - windspeeed) and measured airspeed. The time required to detect a fault when the threshold is exceeded depends on the size of the exceedance and is controlled by the ASPD_FS_INTEG parameter.

parameters.name: ASPD_FS_INTEG
parameters.longDesc: This sets the time integral of airspeed innovation exceedance above ASPD_FS_INNOV required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller positive values make it more sensitive.

parameters.name: ASPD_FS_T_START
parameters.longDesc: Delay before switching back to using airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is good. Set to a negative value to disable the re-enabling in flight.

parameters.name: ASPD_FS_T_STOP
parameters.longDesc: Delay before stopping use of airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is bad.

parameters.name: ASPD_PRIMARY
parameters.shortDesc: Index or primary airspeed measurement source

parameters.name: ASPD_SCALE_1
parameters.longDesc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the first airspeed sensor instance

parameters.name: ASPD_SCALE_2
parameters.longDesc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the second airspeed sensor instance

parameters.name: ASPD_SCALE_3
parameters.longDesc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the third airspeed sensor instance

parameters.name: ASPD_SCALE_APPLY
parameters.shortDesc: Controls when to apply the new estimated airspeed scale(s)

values.description: Do not automatically apply the estimated scale
Apply the estimated scale after disarm
Apply the estimated scale in air

parameters.name: ASPD_SCALE_NSD
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator true airspeed scale process noise spectral density
parameters.longDesc: Airspeed scale process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector. When unaided, the scale uncertainty (1-sigma, unitless) increases by this amount every second.

parameters.name: ASPD_TAS_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed Selector: Gate size for true airspeed fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: ASPD_TAS_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator true airspeed measurement noise
parameters.longDesc: True airspeed measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameters.name: ASPD_WERR_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Horizontal wind uncertainty threshold for synthetic airspeed
parameters.longDesc: The synthetic airspeed estimate (from groundspeed and heading) will be declared valid as soon and as long the horizontal wind uncertainty drops below this value.

parameters.name: ASPD_WIND_NSD
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator wind process noise noise spectral density
parameters.longDesc: Wind process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector. When unaided, the wind estimate uncertainty (1-sigma, in m/s) increases by this amount every second.

parameters.name: ATT_ACC_COMP
parameters.shortDesc: Acceleration compensation based on GPS velocity

parameters.name: ATT_EXT_HDG_M
parameters.shortDesc: External heading usage mode (from Motion capture/Vision)
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to use heading estimate from vision. Set to 2 to use heading from motion capture.

parameters.name: ATT_MAG_DECL
parameters.longDesc: This parameter is not used in normal operation, as the declination is looked up based on the GPS coordinates of the vehicle.

parameters.name: ATT_W_MAG
parameters.longDesc: Set to 0 to avoid using the magnetometer.

parameters.name: FW_AT_APPLY
parameters.shortDesc: Controls when to apply the new gains
parameters.longDesc: After the auto-tuning sequence is completed, a new set of gains is available and can be applied immediately or after landing.

values.description: Do not apply the new gains (logging only)
Apply the new gains after disarm
Apply the new gains in air

parameters.name: FW_AT_AXES
parameters.longDesc: Defines which axes will be tuned during the auto-tuning sequence Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Roll 1 : Pitch 2 : Yaw

parameters.name: FW_AT_MAN_AUX
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto tuning enable on aux input
parameters.longDesc: Defines which aux input to enable auto tuning

parameters.name: FW_AT_START
parameters.longDesc: WARNING: this will inject steps to the rate controller and can be dangerous. Only activate if you know what you are doing, and in a safe environment. Any motion of the remote stick will abort the signal injection and reset this parameter Best is to perform the identification in position or hold mode. Increase the amplitude of the injected signal using FW_AT_SYSID_AMP for more signal/noise ratio

parameters.name: FW_AT_SYSID_AMP
parameters.longDesc: This parameter scales the signal sent to the rate controller during system identification.

parameters.name: MC_AT_APPLY
parameters.shortDesc: Controls when to apply the new gains
parameters.longDesc: After the auto-tuning sequence is completed, a new set of gains is available and can be applied immediately or after landing. WARNING Applying the gains in air is dangerous as there is no guarantee that those new gains will be able to stabilize the drone properly.

values.description: Do not apply the new gains (logging only)
Apply the new gains after disarm
WARNING Apply the new gains in air

parameters.name: MC_AT_RISE_TIME
parameters.shortDesc: Desired angular rate closed-loop rise time

parameters.name: MC_AT_START
parameters.longDesc: WARNING: this will inject steps to the rate controller and can be dangerous. Only activate if you know what you are doing, and in a safe environment. Any motion of the remote stick will abort the signal injection and reset this parameter Best is to perform the identification in position or hold mode. Increase the amplitude of the injected signal using MC_AT_SYSID_AMP for more signal/noise ratio

parameters.name: BAT1_CAPACITY
parameters.longDesc: Defines the capacity of battery 1 in mAh.

parameters.name: BAT1_N_CELLS
parameters.longDesc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameters.name: BAT1_R_INTERNAL
parameters.shortDesc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 1
parameters.longDesc: If non-negative, then this will be used in place of BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP for all calculations.

parameters.name: BAT1_SOURCE
parameters.longDesc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameters.name: BAT1_V_CHARGED
parameters.longDesc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered full under a mild load. This will never be the nominal voltage of 4.2V

parameters.name: BAT1_V_EMPTY
parameters.longDesc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen before the steep dropoff to 2.8V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameters.name: BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP
parameters.shortDesc: Voltage drop per cell on full throttle
parameters.longDesc: This implicitly defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio for battery 1 and assumes linearity. A good value to use is the difference between the 5C and 20-25C load. Not used if BAT1_R_INTERNAL is set.

parameters.name: BAT2_CAPACITY
parameters.longDesc: Defines the capacity of battery 2 in mAh.

parameters.name: BAT2_N_CELLS
parameters.longDesc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameters.name: BAT2_R_INTERNAL
parameters.shortDesc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance for battery 2
parameters.longDesc: If non-negative, then this will be used in place of BAT2_V_LOAD_DROP for all calculations.

parameters.name: BAT2_SOURCE
parameters.longDesc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages. If the value is set to 'ESCs', the battery information are taken from the esc_status message. This requires the ESC to provide both voltage as well as current.

parameters.name: BAT2_V_CHARGED
parameters.longDesc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered full under a mild load. This will never be the nominal voltage of 4.2V

parameters.name: BAT2_V_EMPTY
parameters.longDesc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of battery 1 is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen before the steep dropoff to 2.8V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameters.name: BAT2_V_LOAD_DROP
parameters.shortDesc: Voltage drop per cell on full throttle
parameters.longDesc: This implicitly defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio for battery 1 and assumes linearity. A good value to use is the difference between the 5C and 20-25C load. Not used if BAT2_R_INTERNAL is set.

parameters.name: BAT_AVRG_CURRENT
parameters.longDesc: This value is used to initialize the in-flight average current estimation, which in turn is used for estimating remaining flight time and RTL triggering.

parameters.name: BAT_CRIT_THR
parameters.longDesc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as critically low. This has to be lower than the low threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger RTL.

parameters.name: BAT_EMERGEN_THR
parameters.longDesc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as dangerously low. This has to be lower than the critical threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger landing.

parameters.name: BAT_LOW_THR
parameters.longDesc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as low. This has to be higher than the critical threshold.

parameters.name: BAT_N_CELLS
parameters.shortDesc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_N_CELLS instead

parameters.name: BAT_V_CHARGED
parameters.shortDesc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_CHARGED instead

parameters.name: BAT_V_EMPTY
parameters.shortDesc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_EMPTY instead

parameters.name: BAT_V_LOAD_DROP
parameters.shortDesc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP instead

parameters.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameters.name: TRIG_DISTANCE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the distance at which to trigger the camera.

parameters.name: TRIG_INTERFACE
parameters.longDesc: Selects the trigger interface

parameters.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameters.name: TRIG_MIN_INTERVA
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the minimum time between two consecutive trigger events the specific camera setup is supporting.

parameters.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameters.longDesc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = active low, 1 = active high )

parameters.name: TRIG_PWM_NEUTRAL
parameters.shortDesc: PWM neutral output on trigger pin

parameters.name: CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. The sensor driver will not be started and it cannot be calibrated. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameters.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss, geofence, and takeoff failure detection safety logic.

parameters.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander, setting it to 0 keeps them enabled (recommended). We are generally recommending to not fly with the USB link connected and production vehicles should set this parameter to zero to prevent users from flying USB powered. However, for R&D purposes it has proven over the years to work just fine.

parameters.name: CBRK_VTOLARMING
parameters.shortDesc: Circuit breaker for arming in fixed-wing mode check
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 159753 will enable arming in fixed-wing mode for VTOLs. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameters.name: COM_ACT_FAIL_ACT
parameters.shortDesc: Set the actuator failure failsafe mode
parameters.longDesc: Note: actuator failure needs to be enabled and configured via FD_ACT_* parameters.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_ARSP_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable preflight check for maximal allowed airspeed when arming
parameters.longDesc: Deny arming if the current airspeed measurement is greater than half the cruise airspeed (FW_AIRSPD_TRIM). Excessive airspeed measurements on ground are either caused by wind or bad airspeed calibration.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_ID
parameters.longDesc: Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_MET
parameters.longDesc: Methods: - one arm: request authorization and arm when authorization is received - two step arm: 1st arm command request an authorization and 2nd arm command arm the drone if authorized Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ
parameters.longDesc: By default off. The default allows to arm the vehicle without a arm authorization.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_TO
parameters.longDesc: Timeout for authorizer answer. Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_CHK_ESCS
parameters.shortDesc: Enable checks on ESCs that report telemetry
parameters.longDesc: If this parameter is set, the system will check ESC's online status and failures. This param is specific for ESCs reporting status. It shall be used only if ESCs support telemetry.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_HGT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF height innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_POS
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF position innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_VEL
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF velocity innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameters.name: COM_ARM_EKF_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum EKF yaw innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameters.name: COM_ARM_IMU_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum accelerometer inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameters.name: COM_ARM_IMU_GYR
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum rate gyro inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameters.name: COM_ARM_MAG_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum magnetic field inconsistency between units that will allow arming
parameters.longDesc: Set -1 to disable the check.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_MAG_STR
parameters.longDesc: Check if the estimator detects a strong magnetic disturbance (check enabled by EKF2_MAG_CHECK)

parameters.name: COM_ARM_MIS_REQ
parameters.longDesc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without a valid mission.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_SDCARD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable FMU SD card detection check
parameters.longDesc: This check detects if the FMU SD card is missing. Depending on the value of the parameter, the check can be disabled, warn only or deny arming.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_SWISBTN
parameters.shortDesc: Arm switch is a momentary button
parameters.longDesc: 0: Arming/disarming triggers on switch transition. 1: Arming/disarming triggers when holding the momentary button down for COM_RC_ARM_HYST like the stick gesture.

parameters.name: COM_ARM_WO_GPS
parameters.longDesc: The default allows the vehicle to arm without GPS signal.

parameters.name: COM_CPU_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum allowed CPU load to still arm
parameters.longDesc: A negative value disables the check.

parameters.name: COM_DISARM_LAND
parameters.shortDesc: Time-out for auto disarm after landing
parameters.longDesc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time-out period in seconds after which the vehicle will be automatically disarmed in case a landing situation has been detected during this period. A zero or negative value means that automatic disarming triggered by landing detection is disabled.

parameters.name: COM_DISARM_PRFLT
parameters.shortDesc: Time-out for auto disarm if not taking off
parameters.longDesc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time in seconds, within which the vehicle is expected to take off after arming. In case the vehicle didn't takeoff within the timeout it disarms again. A negative value disables autmoatic disarming triggered by a pre-takeoff timeout.

parameters.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameters.longDesc: After this amount of seconds without datalink, the GCS connection lost mode triggers

parameters.name: COM_FAIL_ACT_T
parameters.shortDesc: Delay between failsafe condition triggered and failsafe reaction
parameters.longDesc: Before entering failsafe (RTL, Land, Hold), wait COM_FAIL_ACT_T seconds in Hold mode for the user to realize. During that time the user cannot take over control. Afterwards the configured failsafe action is triggered and the user may take over. A zero value disables the delay and the user cannot take over via stick movements (switching modes is still allowed).

parameters.name: COM_FLIGHT_UUID
parameters.longDesc: This number is incremented automatically after every flight on disarming in order to remember the next flight UUID. The first flight is 0.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE1
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE2
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE3
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE4
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE5
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLTMODE6
parameters.longDesc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameters.name: COM_FLT_PROFILE
parameters.longDesc: Describes the intended use of the vehicle. Can be used by ground control software or log post processing. This param does not influence the behavior within the firmware. This means for example the control logic is independent of the setting of this param (but depends on other params).

parameters.name: COM_FLT_TIME_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The vehicle aborts the current operation and returns to launch when the time since takeoff is above this value. It is not possible to resume the mission or switch to any mode other than RTL or Land. Set a negative value to disable.

parameters.name: COM_FORCE_SAFETY
parameters.longDesc: Force safety when the vehicle disarms

parameters.name: COM_HLDL_LOSS_T
parameters.shortDesc: High Latency Datalink loss time threshold
parameters.longDesc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameters.name: COM_HLDL_REG_T
parameters.shortDesc: High Latency Datalink regain time threshold
parameters.longDesc: After a data link loss: after this number of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameters.name: COM_HOME_EN
parameters.longDesc: Set home position automatically if possible.

parameters.name: COM_HOME_IN_AIR
parameters.shortDesc: Allows setting the home position after takeoff
parameters.longDesc: If set to true, the autopilot is allowed to set its home position after takeoff The true home position is back-computed if a local position is estimate if available. If no local position is available, home is set to the current position.

parameters.name: COM_IMB_PROP_ACT
parameters.longDesc: Action the system takes when an imbalanced propeller is detected by the failure detector. See also FD_IMB_PROP_THR to set the failure threshold.

parameters.name: COM_KILL_DISARM
parameters.shortDesc: Timeout value for disarming when kill switch is engaged

parameters.name: COM_LKDOWN_TKO
parameters.shortDesc: Timeout for detecting a failure after takeoff
parameters.longDesc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the timeframe in seconds within failure detector is allowed to disarm the vehicle if attitude exceeds the limits defined in FD_FAIL_P and FD_FAIL_R. The check is not executed for flight modes that do support acrobatic maneuvers, e.g: Acro (MC/FW) and Manual (FW). A zero or negative value means that the check is disabled.

parameters.name: COM_LOW_BAT_ACT
parameters.longDesc: Action the system takes at critical battery. See also BAT_CRIT_THR and BAT_EMERGEN_THR for definition of battery states.

values.description: Return at critical level, land at emergency level

parameters.name: COM_MOT_TEST_EN
parameters.longDesc: If set, enables the motor test interface via MAVLink (DO_MOTOR_TEST), that allows spinning the motors for testing purposes.

parameters.name: COM_OBC_LOSS_T
parameters.shortDesc: Time-out to wait when onboard computer connection is lost before warning about loss connection

parameters.name: COM_OBL_RC_ACT
parameters.longDesc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameters.name: COM_OF_LOSS_T
parameters.shortDesc: Time-out to wait when offboard connection is lost before triggering offboard lost action
parameters.longDesc: See COM_OBL_RC_ACT to configure action.

parameters.name: COM_PARACHUTE
parameters.shortDesc: Expect and require a healthy MAVLink parachute system

parameters.name: COM_POSCTL_NAVL
parameters.longDesc: This sets the flight mode that will be used if navigation accuracy is no longer adequate for position control. If Altitude/Manual is selected: assume use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Altitude mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to MANUAL. If Land/Terminate is selected: assume no use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Land mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to TERMINATION.

parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Loss of position failsafe activation delay
parameters.longDesc: This sets number of seconds that the position checks need to be failed before the failsafe will activate. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a larger value between 5 and 10 should be used.

parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_EPH
parameters.longDesc: This is the horizontal position error (EPH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameters.name: COM_POS_FS_EPV
parameters.longDesc: This is the vertical position error (EPV) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameters.name: COM_POWER_COUNT
parameters.shortDesc: Required number of redundant power modules
parameters.longDesc: This configures a check to verify the expected number of 5V rail power supplies are present. By default only one is expected. Note: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK disables all power checks including this one.

parameters.name: COM_PREARM_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Condition to enter the prearmed state, an intermediate state between disarmed and armed in which non-throttling actuators are active.

values.description: No action: stay in current flight mode

parameters.name: COM_RCL_ACT_T
parameters.shortDesc: Delay between RC loss and configured reaction
parameters.longDesc: RC signal not updated -> still use data for COM_RC_LOSS_T seconds Consider RC signal lost -> wait COM_RCL_ACT_T seconds in Hold mode to regain signal React with failsafe action NAV_RCL_ACT A zero value disables the delay.

parameters.name: COM_RCL_EXCEPT
parameters.longDesc: Specify modes in which RC loss is ignored and the failsafe action not triggered.

parameters.name: COM_RC_ARM_HYST
parameters.longDesc: The default value of 1000 requires the stick to be held in the arm or disarm position for 1 second.

parameters.name: COM_RC_IN_MODE
parameters.longDesc: A value of 0 enables RC transmitter control (only). A valid RC transmitter calibration is required. A value of 1 allows joystick control only. RC input handling and the associated checks are disabled. A value of 2 allows either RC Transmitter or Joystick input. The first valid input is used, will fallback to other sources if the input stream becomes invalid. A value of 3 allows either input from RC or joystick. The first available source is selected and used until reboot. A value of 4 ignores any stick input.

parameters.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameters.longDesc: After this amount of seconds without RC connection it's considered lost and not used anymore

parameters.name: COM_RC_OVERRIDE
parameters.shortDesc: Enable RC stick override of auto and/or offboard modes
parameters.longDesc: When RC stick override is enabled, moving the RC sticks more than COM_RC_STICK_OV immediately gives control back to the pilot by switching to Position mode and if position is unavailable Altitude mode. Note: Only has an effect on multicopters, and VTOLs in multicopter mode. This parameter is not considered in case of a GPS failure (Descend flight mode), where stick override is always enabled.

bitmask.description: Enable override during auto modes (except for in critical battery reaction)

parameters.name: COM_RC_STICK_OV
parameters.longDesc: If COM_RC_OVERRIDE is enabled and the joystick input is moved more than this threshold the autopilot the pilot takes over control.

parameters.name: COM_SPOOLUP_TIME
parameters.shortDesc: Enforced delay between arming and further navigation
parameters.longDesc: The minimal time from arming the motors until moving the vehicle is possible is COM_SPOOLUP_TIME seconds. Goal: - Motors and propellers spool up to idle speed before getting commanded to spin faster - Timeout for ESCs and smart batteries to successfulyy do failure checks e.g. for stuck rotors before the vehicle is off the ground

parameters.name: COM_TAKEOFF_ACT
parameters.shortDesc: Action after TAKEOFF has been accepted
parameters.longDesc: The mode transition after TAKEOFF has completed successfully.

parameters.name: COM_VEL_FS_EVH
parameters.longDesc: This is the horizontal velocity error (EVH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameters.name: COM_WIND_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Wind speed threshold above which an automatic return to launch is triggered and enforced as long as the threshold is exceeded. A negative value disables the feature.

parameters.name: COM_WIND_WARN
parameters.longDesc: A warning is triggered if the currently estimated wind speed is above this value. Warning is sent periodically (every 1min). A negative value disables the feature.

parameters.name: NAV_DLL_ACT
parameters.shortDesc: Set GCS connection loss failsafe mode
parameters.longDesc: The GCS connection loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_DL_LOSS_T in seconds. Once the timeout occurs the selected action will be executed.

parameters.name: NAV_RCL_ACT
parameters.longDesc: The RC loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_RC_LOSS_T in seconds. If RC input checks have been disabled by setting the COM_RC_IN_MODE param it will not be triggered.

parameters.name: NAV_AH_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Altitude of airfield home waypoint

parameters.name: NAV_AH_LAT
parameters.longDesc: Latitude of airfield home waypoint

parameters.name: NAV_AH_LON
parameters.longDesc: Longitude of airfield home waypoint

parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_ACCLIM
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum IMU accel magnitude that allows IMU bias learning
parameters.longDesc: If the magnitude of the IMU accelerometer vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of high manoeuvre accelerations and IMU nonlinerity and scale factor errors on the delta velocity bias estimates.

parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_GYRLIM
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum IMU gyro angular rate magnitude that allows IMU bias learning
parameters.longDesc: If the magnitude of the IMU angular rate vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of rapid rotation rates and associated errors on the delta velocity bias estimates.

parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_LIM
parameters.longDesc: The ekf delta velocity bias states will be limited to within a range equivalent to +- of this value.

parameters.name: EKF2_ABL_TAU
parameters.shortDesc: Time constant used by acceleration and angular rate magnitude checks used to inhibit delta velocity bias learning
parameters.longDesc: The vector magnitude of angular rate and acceleration used to check if learning should be inhibited has a peak hold filter applied to it with an exponential decay. This parameter controls the time constant of the decay.

parameters.name: EKF2_ACC_B_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for IMU accelerometer bias prediction

parameters.name: EKF2_AID_MASK
parameters.shortDesc: Integer bitmask controlling data fusion and aiding methods
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Deprecated, use EKF2_GPS_CTRL instead 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to inhibit IMU delta velocity bias estimation 3 : Set to true to enable vision position fusion 4 : Set to true to enable vision yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 7 is true. 5 : Set to true to enable multi-rotor drag specific force fusion 6 : set to true if the EV observations are in a non NED reference frame and need to be rotated before being used 7 : Deprecated, use EKF2_GPS_CTRL instead 8 : Set to true to enable vision velocity fusion

parameters.name: EKF2_ANGERR_INIT
parameters.shortDesc: 1-sigma tilt angle uncertainty after gravity vector alignment

parameters.name: EKF2_ARSP_THR
parameters.longDesc: A value of zero will deactivate airspeed fusion. Any other positive value will determine the minimum airspeed which will still be fused. Set to about 90% of the vehicles stall speed. Both airspeed fusion and sideslip fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_FUSE_BETA to activate sideslip fusion.

parameters.name: EKF2_ASPD_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Upper limit on airspeed along individual axes used to correct baro for position error effects

parameters.name: EKF2_ASP_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_AVEL_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary Velocity Estimate (e.g from a landing target) delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_BARO_CTRL
parameters.longDesc: If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the barometric height measurements to estimate it's height in addition to other height sources (if activated).

parameters.name: EKF2_BARO_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Barometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_BARO_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for barometric and GPS height fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_BCOEF_X
parameters.shortDesc: X-axis ballistic coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameters.longDesc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by bluff body drag along the forward/reverse axis when flying a multi-copter which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter. The EKF2_BCOEF_X paraemter should be set initially to the ratio of mass / projected frontal area and adjusted together with EKF2_MCOEF to minimise variance of the X-axis drag specific force innovation sequence. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. Set this parameter to zero to turn off the bluff body drag model for this axis. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EKF2_MCOEF parameter.

parameters.name: EKF2_BCOEF_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y-axis ballistic coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameters.longDesc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by bluff body drag along the right/left axis when flying a multi-copter, which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter. The EKF2_BCOEF_Y paraemter should be set initially to the ratio of mass / projected side area and adjusted together with EKF2_MCOEF to minimise variance of the Y-axis drag specific force innovation sequence. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. et this parameter to zero to turn off the bluff body drag model for this axis. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EKF2_MCOEF parameter.

parameters.name: EKF2_BETA_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for synthetic sideslip fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_DECL_TYPE
parameters.shortDesc: Integer bitmask controlling handling of magnetic declination
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable functions. 0 : Set to true to use the declination from the geo_lookup library when the GPS position becomes available, set to false to always use the EKF2_MAG_DECL value. 1 : Set to true to save the EKF2_MAG_DECL parameter to the value returned by the EKF when the vehicle disarms. 2 : Set to true to always use the declination as an observation when 3-axis magnetometer fusion is being used.

parameters.name: EKF2_DRAG_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Specific drag force observation noise variance used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model
parameters.longDesc: Increasing this makes the multi-rotor wind estimates adjust more slowly.

parameters.name: EKF2_EVA_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for vision angle observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameters.name: EKF2_EVP_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for vision position fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_EVP_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for vision position observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameters.name: EKF2_EVV_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for vision velocity estimate fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_EVV_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for vision velocity observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameters.name: EKF2_EV_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Vision Position Estimator delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_EV_NOISE_MD
parameters.shortDesc: Whether to set the external vision observation noise from the parameter or from vision message
parameters.longDesc: If set to true the observation noise is set from the parameters directly, if set to false the measurement noise is taken from the vision message and the parameter are used as a lower bound.

parameters.name: EKF2_EV_POS_X
parameters.shortDesc: X position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Z position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_FUSE_BETA
parameters.shortDesc: Boolean determining if synthetic sideslip measurements should fused
parameters.longDesc: A value of 1 indicates that fusion is active Both  sideslip fusion and airspeed fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_ARSP_THR to activate airspeed fusion.

parameters.name: EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ
parameters.shortDesc: Baro deadzone range for height fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the value of deadzone applied to negative baro innovations. Deadzone is enabled when EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ > 0.

parameters.name: EKF2_GND_MAX_HGT
parameters.shortDesc: Height above ground level for ground effect zone
parameters.longDesc: Sets the maximum distance to the ground level where negative baro innovations are expected.

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_CHECK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits to 1 to enable checks. Checks enabled by the following bit positions 0 : Minimum required sat count set by EKF2_REQ_NSATS 1 : Maximum allowed PDOP set by EKF2_REQ_PDOP 2 : Maximum allowed horizontal position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPH 3 : Maximum allowed vertical position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPV 4 : Maximum allowed speed error set by EKF2_REQ_SACC 5 : Maximum allowed horizontal position rate set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. 6 : Maximum allowed vertical position rate set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. 7 : Maximum allowed horizontal speed set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. 8 : Maximum allowed vertical velocity discrepancy set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_CTRL
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Longitude and latitude fusion 1 : Altitude fusion 2 : 3D velocity fusion 3 : Dual antenna heading fusion

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: GPS measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_X
parameters.shortDesc: X position of GPS antenna in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y position of GPS antenna in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Z position of GPS antenna in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_P_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for GPS horizontal position fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_V_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for GPS velocity fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_GPS_V_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for gps horizontal velocity

parameters.name: EKF2_GSF_TAS
parameters.shortDesc: Default value of true airspeed used in EKF-GSF AHRS calculation
parameters.longDesc: If no airspeed measurements are available, the EKF-GSF AHRS calculation will assume this value of true airspeed when compensating for centripetal acceleration during turns. Set to zero to disable centripetal acceleration compensation during fixed wing flight modes.

parameters.name: EKF2_GYR_B_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for IMU rate gyro bias prediction

parameters.name: EKF2_GYR_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Rate gyro noise for covariance prediction

parameters.name: EKF2_HDG_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for magnetic heading fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_HEAD_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for magnetic heading fusion

parameters.name: EKF2_HGT_REF
parameters.shortDesc: Determines the reference source of height data used by the EKF
parameters.longDesc: When multiple height sources are enabled at the same time, the height estimate will always converge towards the reference height source selected by this parameter. The range sensor and vision options should only be used when for operation over a flat surface as the local NED origin will move up and down with ground level.

parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_X
parameters.shortDesc: X position of IMU in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y position of IMU in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Z position of IMU in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_ACCLIM
parameters.shortDesc: Horizontal acceleration threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method
parameters.longDesc: This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered horizontal acceleration is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion.

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_B_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for body magnetic field prediction

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_CHECK
parameters.longDesc: When set, the EKF checks the strength of the magnetic field to decide whether the magnetometer data is valid. If GPS data is received, the magnetic field is compared to a World Magnetic Model (WMM), otherwise an average value is used. This check is useful to reject occasional hard iron disturbance.

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Magnetometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_E_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Process noise for earth magnetic field prediction

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for magnetometer XYZ component fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Integer controlling the type of magnetometer fusion used - magnetic heading or 3-component vector. The fuson of magnetomer data as a three component vector enables vehicle body fixed hard iron errors to be learned, but requires a stable earth field. If set to 'Automatic' magnetic heading fusion is used when on-ground and 3-axis magnetic field fusion in-flight with fallback to magnetic heading fusion if there is insufficient motion to make yaw or magnetic field states observable. If set to 'Magnetic heading' magnetic heading fusion is used at all times If set to '3-axis' 3-axis field fusion is used at all times. If set to 'VTOL custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic', but if fusing airspeed, magnetometer fusion is only allowed to modify the magnetic field states. This can be used by VTOL platforms with large magnetic field disturbances to prevent incorrect bias states being learned during forward flight operation which can adversely affect estimation accuracy after transition to hovering flight. If set to 'MC custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic, but if there are no earth frame position or velocity observations being used, the magnetometer will not be used. This enables vehicles to operate with no GPS in environments where the magnetic field cannot be used to provide a heading reference. Prior to flight, the yaw angle is assumed to be constant if movement tests indicate that the vehicle is static. This allows the vehicle to be placed on the ground to learn the yaw gyro bias prior to flight. If set to 'None' the magnetometer will not be used under any circumstance. If no external source of yaw is available, it is possible to use post-takeoff horizontal movement combined with GPS velocity measurements to align the yaw angle with the timer required (depending on the amount of movement and GPS data quality). Other external sources of yaw may be used if selected via the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter.

parameters.name: EKF2_MAG_YAWLIM
parameters.shortDesc: Yaw rate threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method
parameters.longDesc: This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered yaw rate is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion.

parameters.name: EKF2_MCOEF
parameters.shortDesc: propeller momentum drag coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameters.longDesc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by the propellers when flying a multi-copter, which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed not speed squared and is produced because some of the air velocity normal to the propeller axis of rotation is lost when passing through the rotor disc. This  changes the momentum of the flow which creates a drag reaction force. When comparing un-ducted propellers of the same diameter, the effect is roughly proportional to the area of the propeller blades when viewed side on and changes with propeller selection. Momentum drag is significantly higher for ducted rotors. For example, if flying at 10 m/s at sea level conditions produces a rotor induced drag deceleration of 1.5 m/s/s when the multi-copter levelled to zero roll/pitch, then EKF2_MCOEF would be set to 0.15 = (1.5/10.0). Set EKF2_MCOEF to a positive value to enable wind estimation using this drag effect. To account for the drag produced by the body which scales with speed squared, see documentation for the EKF2_BCOEF_X and EKF2_BCOEF_Y parameters. The EKF2_MCOEF parameter should be adjusted together with EKF2_BCOEF_X and EKF2_BCOEF_Y to minimise variance of the X and y axis drag specific force innovation sequences.

parameters.name: EKF2_MIN_RNG
parameters.shortDesc: Expected range finder reading when on ground
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle is on ground, is not moving as determined by the motion test and the range finder is returning invalid or no data, then an assumed range value of EKF2_MIN_RNG will be used by the terrain estimator so that a terrain height estimate is available at the start of flight in situations where the range finder may be inside its minimum measurements distance when on ground.

parameters.name: EKF2_MULTI_IMU
parameters.longDesc: Maximum number of IMUs to use for Multi-EKF. Set 0 to disable. Requires SENS_IMU_MODE 0.

parameters.name: EKF2_MULTI_MAG
parameters.longDesc: Maximum number of magnetometers to use for Multi-EKF. Set 0 to disable. Requires SENS_MAG_MODE 0.

parameters.name: EKF2_NOAID_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for non-aiding position hold

parameters.name: EKF2_NOAID_TOUT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum lapsed time from last fusion of measurements that constrain velocity drift before the EKF will report the horizontal nav solution as invalid

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameters.longDesc: Assumes measurement is timestamped at trailing edge of integration period

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for optical flow fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_N_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor
parameters.longDesc: (when it's reported quality metric is at the minimum set by EKF2_OF_QMIN). The following condition must be met: EKF2_OF_N_MAXN >= EKF2_OF_N_MIN

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_N_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor when it's reported quality metric is at the maximum

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_POS_X
parameters.shortDesc: X position of optical flow focal point in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y position of optical flow focal point in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Z position of optical flow focal point in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_OF_QMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Optical Flow data will only be used if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN

parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XN
parameters.shortDesc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the negative X axis
parameters.longDesc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number.

parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XP
parameters.shortDesc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the positive X axis
parameters.longDesc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forward flight, then this will be a negative number.

parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YN
parameters.shortDesc: Pressure position error coefficient for the negative Y axis
parameters.longDesc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the negative Y (LH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this will be a negative number.

parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YP
parameters.shortDesc: Pressure position error coefficient for the positive Y axis
parameters.longDesc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the positive Y (RH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this will be a negative number.

parameters.name: EKF2_PCOEF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the Z axis
parameters.longDesc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the Z body axis.

parameters.name: EKF2_PREDICT_US
parameters.longDesc: EKF prediction period in microseconds. This should ideally be an integer multiple of the IMU time delta. Actual filter update will be an integer multiple of IMU update.

parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_GPS_H
parameters.shortDesc: Required GPS health time on startup
parameters.longDesc: Minimum continuous period without GPS failure required to mark a healthy GPS status. It can be reduced to speed up initialization, but it's recommended to keep this unchanged for a vehicle.

parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal drift speed to use GPS

parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_NSATS
parameters.shortDesc: Required satellite count to use GPS

parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_SACC
parameters.shortDesc: Required speed accuracy to use GPS

parameters.name: EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical drift speed to use GPS

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum absolute altitude (height above ground level) allowed for conditional range aid mode
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle absolute altitude exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when conditional range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_CTRL = 1).

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_A_IGATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size used for innovation consistency checks for range aid fusion
parameters.longDesc: A lower value means HAGL needs to be more stable in order to use range finder for height estimation in range aid mode

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed for conditional range aid mode
parameters.longDesc: If the vehicle horizontal speed exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when conditional range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_CTRL = 1).

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_CTRL
parameters.longDesc: WARNING: Range finder measurements are less reliable and can experience unexpected errors. For these reasons, if accurate control of height relative to ground is required, it is recommended to use the MPC_ALT_MODE parameter instead, unless baro errors are severe enough to cause problems with landing and takeoff. To en-/disable range finder for terrain height estimation, use EKF2_TERR_MASK instead. If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the range finder measurements to estimate it's height in addition to other height sources (if activated). Range sensor aiding can be enabled (i.e.: always use) or set in "conditional" mode. Conditional mode: This enables the range finder to be used during low speed (< EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX) and low altitude (< EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX) operation, eg takeoff and landing, where baro interference from rotor wash is excessive and can corrupt EKF state estimates. It is intended to be used where a vertical takeoff and landing is performed, and horizontal flight does not occur until above EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX.

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Range finder measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size for range finder fusion
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_K_GATE
parameters.shortDesc: Gate size used for range finder kinematic consistency check
parameters.longDesc: To be used, the time derivative of the distance sensor measurements projected on the vertical axis needs to be statistically consistent with the estimated vertical velocity of the drone. Decrease this value to make the filter more robust against range finder faulty data (stuck, reflections, ...). Note: tune the range finder noise parameters (EKF2_RNG_NOISE and EKF2_RNG_SFE) before tuning this gate.

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Measurement noise for range finder fusion

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_X
parameters.shortDesc: X position of range finder origin in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y position of range finder origin in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Z position of range finder origin in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_QLTY_T
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum duration during which the reported range finder signal quality needs to be non-zero in order to be declared valid (s)

parameters.name: EKF2_RNG_SFE
parameters.shortDesc: Range finder range dependent noise scaler
parameters.longDesc: Specifies the increase in range finder noise with range.

parameters.name: EKF2_SEL_ERR_RED
parameters.longDesc: EKF2 instances have to be better than the selected by at least this amount before their relative score can be reduced.

parameters.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_ACC
parameters.longDesc: EKF2 selector acceleration error threshold for comparing accelerometers. Acceleration vector differences larger than this will result in accumulated velocity error.

parameters.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_ANG
parameters.longDesc: EKF2 selector maximum accumulated angular error threshold for comparing gyros. Accumulated angular error larger than this will result in the sensor being declared faulty.

parameters.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_RAT
parameters.longDesc: EKF2 selector angular rate error threshold for comparing gyros. Angular rate vector differences larger than this will result in accumulated angular error.

parameters.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_VEL
parameters.longDesc: EKF2 selector maximum accumulated velocity threshold for comparing accelerometers. Accumulated velocity error larger than this will result in the sensor being declared faulty.

parameters.name: EKF2_SYNT_MAG_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Enable synthetic magnetometer Z component measurement
parameters.longDesc: Use for vehicles where the measured body Z magnetic field is subject to strong magnetic interference. For magnetic heading fusion the magnetometer Z measurement will be replaced by a synthetic value calculated using the knowledge of the 3D magnetic field vector at the location of the drone. Therefore, this parameter will only have an effect if the global position of the drone is known. For 3D mag fusion the magnetometer Z measurement will simply be ignored instead of fusing the synthetic value.

parameters.name: EKF2_TAS_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: EKF2_TAU_POS
parameters.shortDesc: Time constant of the position output prediction and smoothing filter. Controls how tightly the output track the EKF states

parameters.name: EKF2_TAU_VEL
parameters.shortDesc: Time constant of the velocity output prediction and smoothing filter

parameters.name: EKF2_TERR_MASK
parameters.shortDesc: Integer bitmask controlling fusion sources of the terrain estimator
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to use range finder data if available 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available

parameters.name: EKF2_TERR_NOISE
parameters.shortDesc: Terrain altitude process noise - accounts for instability in vehicle height estimate

parameters.name: EKF2_WIND_NSD
parameters.shortDesc: Process noise spectral density for wind velocity prediction
parameters.longDesc: When unaided, the wind estimate uncertainty (1-sigma, in m/s) increases by this amount every second.

parameters.name: EV_TSK_RC_LOSS
parameters.longDesc: Enable/disable event task for RC Loss. When enabled, an alarm tune will be played via buzzer or ESCs, if supported. The alarm will sound after a disarm, if the vehicle was previously armed and only if the vehicle had RC signal at some point. Particularly useful for locating crashed drones without a GPS sensor.

parameters.name: EV_TSK_STAT_DIS
parameters.longDesc: Enable/disable event task for displaying the vehicle status using arm-mounted LEDs. When enabled and if the vehicle supports it, LEDs will flash indicating various vehicle status changes. Currently PX4 has not implemented any specific status events. -

parameters.name: FW_ACRO_X_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full roll stick input in acro mode.

parameters.name: FW_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the body y rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full pitch stick input in acro mode.

parameters.name: FW_ACRO_Z_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the body z rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full yaw stick input in acro mode.

parameters.name: FW_ARSP_MODE
parameters.longDesc: For small wings or VTOL without airspeed sensor this parameter can be used to enable flying without an airspeed reading

parameters.name: FW_ARSP_SCALE_EN
parameters.longDesc: This enables a logic that automatically adjusts the output of the rate controller to take into account the real torque produced by an aerodynamic control surface given the current deviation from the trim airspeed (FW_AIRSPD_TRIM). Enable when using aerodynamic control surfaces (e.g.: plane) Disable when using rotor wings (e.g.: autogyro)

parameters.name: FW_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Whether to scale throttle by battery power level
parameters.longDesc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The fixed wing should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max thrust at lower battery percentages. i.e. if cruise speed is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_FLPS
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment for flaps configuration
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to the pitch trim whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_SPOIL
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment for spoiler configuration
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to the pitch trim whenever spoilers are fully deployed.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_R_FLPS
parameters.shortDesc: Roll trim increment for flaps configuration
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Roll trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Roll trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Yaw trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Yaw trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameters.longDesc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameters.name: FW_FLAPS_LND_SCL
parameters.longDesc: Sets a fraction of full flaps during landing. Also applies to flaperons if enabled in the mixer/allocation.

parameters.name: FW_FLAPS_TO_SCL
parameters.longDesc: Sets a fraction of full flaps during take-off. Also applies to flaperons if enabled in the mixer/allocation.

parameters.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum manual pitch angle setpoint (positive & negative) in manual attitude-only stabilized mode

parameters.name: FW_MAN_P_SC
parameters.longDesc: Scale factor applied to the desired pitch actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameters.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum manual roll angle setpoint (positive & negative) in manual attitude-only stabilized mode

parameters.name: FW_MAN_R_SC
parameters.longDesc: Scale factor applied to the desired roll actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameters.name: FW_MAN_Y_SC
parameters.longDesc: Scale factor applied to the desired yaw actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameters.name: FW_PR_D
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: FW_PR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameters.name: FW_PR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameters.name: FW_PR_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch setpoint offset (pitch at level flight)
parameters.longDesc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the pitch at typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameters.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum pitch down up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum pitch up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_P_TC
parameters.longDesc: This defines the latency between a pitch step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameters.name: FW_RLL_TO_YAW_FF
parameters.shortDesc: Roll control to yaw control feedforward gain
parameters.longDesc: This gain can be used to counteract the "adverse yaw" effect for fixed wings. When the plane enters a roll it will tend to yaw the nose out of the turn. This gain enables the use of a yaw actuator (rudder, airbrakes, ...) to counteract this effect.

parameters.name: FW_RR_D
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: FW_RR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output. Use this to obtain a tigher response of the controller without introducing noise amplification.

parameters.name: FW_RR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameters.name: FW_RR_P
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: FW_R_RMAX
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum roll rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_R_TC
parameters.longDesc: This defines the latency between a roll step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameters.name: FW_SPOILERS_MAN
parameters.longDesc: Chose source for manual setting of spoilers in manual flight modes.

parameters.name: FW_WR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameters.name: FW_WR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_WR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameters.name: FW_WR_P
parameters.longDesc: This defines how much the wheel steering input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameters.name: FW_W_RMAX
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum wheel steering rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_YR_D
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: FW_YR_FF
parameters.longDesc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameters.name: FW_YR_I
parameters.longDesc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameters.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameters.name: FW_YR_P
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: FW_Y_RMAX
parameters.longDesc: This limits the maximum yaw rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameters.name: FW_LND_ABORT
parameters.shortDesc: Bit mask to set the automatic landing abort conditions
parameters.longDesc: Terrain estimation: bit 0: Abort if terrain is not found bit 1: Abort if terrain times out (after a first successful measurement) The last estimate is always used as ground, whether the last valid measurement or the land waypoint, depending on the selected abort criteria, until an abort condition is entered. If FW_LND_USETER == 0, these bits are ignored. TODO: Extend automatic abort conditions e.g. glide slope tracking error (horizontal and vertical)

bitmask.description: Abort if terrain is not found
Abort if terrain times out (after a first successful measurement)

parameters.name: FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC
parameters.shortDesc: Min. airspeed scaling factor for landing
parameters.longDesc: Multiplying this factor with the minimum airspeed of the plane gives the target airspeed the landing approach. FW_AIRSPD_MIN * FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC

parameters.name: FW_LND_ANG
parameters.longDesc: Typically the desired landing slope angle when landing configuration (flaps, airspeed) is enabled. Set this value within the vehicle's performance limits.

parameters.name: FW_LND_EARLYCFG
parameters.longDesc: When disabled, the landing configuration (flaps, landing airspeed, etc.) is only activated on the final approach to landing. When enabled, it is already activated when entering the final loiter-down (loiter-to-alt) waypoint before the landing approach. This shifts the (often large) altitude and airspeed errors caused by the configuration change away from the ground such that these are not so critical. It also gives the controller enough time to adapt to the new configuration such that the landing approach starts with a cleaner initial state.

parameters.name: FW_LND_FLALT
parameters.shortDesc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)
parameters.longDesc: NOTE: max(FW_LND_FLALT, FW_LND_FL_TIME * |z-velocity|) is taken as the flare altitude

parameters.name: FW_LND_FL_PMAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once flaring is triggered

parameters.name: FW_LND_FL_PMIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once flaring is triggered

parameters.name: FW_LND_FL_SINK
parameters.longDesc: TECS will attempt to control the aircraft to this sink rate via pitch angle (throttle killed during flare)

parameters.name: FW_LND_FL_TIME
parameters.longDesc: Multiplied by the descent rate to calculate a dynamic altitude at which to trigger the flare. NOTE: max(FW_LND_FLALT, FW_LND_FL_TIME * descent rate) is taken as the flare altitude

parameters.name: FW_LND_NUDGE
parameters.longDesc: Approach angle nudging: shifts the touchdown point laterally while keeping the approach entrance point constant Approach path nudging: shifts the touchdown point laterally along with the entire approach path This is useful for manually adjusting the landing point in real time when map or GNSS errors cause an offset from the desired landing vector. Nuding is done with yaw stick, constrained to FW_LND_TD_OFF (in meters) and the direction is relative to the vehicle heading (stick deflection to the right = land point moves to the right as seen by the vehicle).

parameters.name: FW_LND_TD_OFF
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum lateral position offset for the touchdown point

parameters.name: FW_LND_THRTC_SC
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude time constant factor for landing
parameters.longDesc: Set this parameter to less than 1.0 to make TECS react faster to altitude errors during landing than during normal flight (i.e. giving efficiency and low motor wear at high altitudes but control accuracy during landing). During landing, the TECS altitude time constant (FW_T_ALT_TC) is multiplied by this value.

parameters.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameters.shortDesc: Use terrain estimation during landing. This is critical for detecting when to flare, and should be enabled if possible
parameters.longDesc: NOTE: terrain estimate is currently solely derived from a distance sensor.
