If enabled and no measurement is found within a given timeout, the landing waypoint altitude will be used OR the landing will be aborted, depending on the criteria set in FW_LND_ABORT. If disabled, FW_LND_ABORT terrain based criteria are ignored.

values.description: Use the terrain estimate to trigger the flare (only)
Calculate landing glide slope relative to the terrain estimate

parameters.name: FW_WING_HEIGHT
parameters.shortDesc: Height (AGL) of the wings when the aircraft is on the ground
parameters.longDesc: This is used to constrain a minimum altitude below which we keep wings level to avoid wing tip strike. It's safer to give a slight margin here (> 0m)

parameters.name: FW_WING_SPAN
parameters.shortDesc: The aircraft's wing span (length from tip to tip)
parameters.longDesc: This is used for limiting the roll setpoint near the ground. (if multiple wings, take the longest span)

parameters.name: FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF
parameters.longDesc: If the altitude error exceeds this parameter, the system will climb out with maximum throttle and minimum airspeed until it is closer than this distance to the desired altitude. Mostly used for takeoff waypoints / modes. Set to 0 to disable climbout mode (not recommended).

parameters.name: FW_L1_DAMPING
parameters.longDesc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameters.name: FW_L1_PERIOD
parameters.longDesc: Used to determine the L1 gain and controller time constant. This parameter is proportional to the L1 distance (which points ahead of the aircraft on the path it is following). A value of 18-25 seconds works for most aircraft. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameters.name: FW_L1_R_SLEW_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: L1 controller roll slew rate limit
parameters.longDesc: The maximum change in roll angle setpoint per second.

parameters.name: FW_POS_STK_CONF
parameters.longDesc: Set RC/joystick configuration for fixed-wing manual position and altitude controlled flight.

bitmask.description: Alternative stick configuration (height rate on throttle stick, airspeed on pitch stick)
Enable airspeed setpoint via sticks in altitude and position flight mode

parameters.name: FW_R_LIM
parameters.longDesc: The maximum roll angle setpoint for autonomous modes including altitude and position control.

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_A
parameters.longDesc: LAUN_CAT_A for LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_MDEL
parameters.longDesc: Delay between starting attitude control and powering up the throttle (giving throttle control to the controller) Before this timespan is up the throttle will be set to FW_THR_IDLE, set to 0 to deactivate

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_PMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum pitch before the throttle is powered up (during motor delay phase)
parameters.longDesc: This is an extra limit for the maximum pitch which is imposed in the phase before the throttle turns on. This allows to limit the maximum pitch angle during a bungee launch (make the launch less steep).

parameters.name: LAUN_CAT_T
parameters.longDesc: LAUN_CAT_A for LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameters.name: FW_USE_NPFG
parameters.shortDesc: Use NPFG as lateral-directional guidance law for fixed-wing vehicles
parameters.longDesc: Replaces L1.

parameters.name: NPFG_DAMPING
parameters.longDesc: Damping ratio of the NPFG control law.

parameters.name: NPFG_EN_MIN_GSP
parameters.shortDesc: Enable minimum forward ground speed maintaining excess wind handling logic

parameters.name: NPFG_GSP_MAX_TK
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum, minimum forward ground speed for track keeping in excess wind
parameters.longDesc: The maximum value of the minimum forward ground speed that may be commanded by the track keeping excess wind handling logic. Commanded in full at the normalized track error fraction of the track error boundary and reduced to zero on track.

parameters.name: NPFG_LB_PERIOD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable automatic lower bound on the NPFG period
parameters.longDesc: Avoids limit cycling from a too aggressively tuned period/damping combination. If set to false, also disables the upper bound NPFG_PERIOD_UB.

parameters.name: NPFG_PERIOD
parameters.longDesc: Period of the NPFG control law.

parameters.name: NPFG_PERIOD_SF
parameters.longDesc: Multiplied by period for conservative minimum period bounding (when period lower bounding is enabled). 1.0 bounds at marginal stability.

parameters.name: NPFG_ROLL_TC
parameters.longDesc: Time constant of roll controller command / response, modeled as first order delay. Used to determine lower period bound. Setting zero disables automatic period bounding.

parameters.name: NPFG_SW_DST_MLT
parameters.longDesc: Multiplied by the track error boundary to determine when the aircraft switches to the next waypoint and/or path segment. Should be less than 1. 1/pi (0.32) sets the switch distance equivalent to that of the L1 controller.

parameters.name: NPFG_TRACK_KEEP
parameters.shortDesc: Enable track keeping excess wind handling logic

parameters.name: NPFG_UB_PERIOD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable automatic upper bound on the NPFG period
parameters.longDesc: Adapts period to maintain track keeping in variable winds and path curvature.

parameters.name: NPFG_WIND_REG
parameters.longDesc: Disabling this parameter further disables all other airspeed incrementation options.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameters.longDesc: If the CAS (calibrated airspeed) is above this value, the TECS controller will try to decrease airspeed more aggressively.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameters.longDesc: The minimal airspeed (calibrated airspeed) the user is able to command. Further, if the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_STALL
parameters.longDesc: The stall airspeed (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. It is used for airspeed sensor failure detection and for the control surface scaling airspeed limits.

parameters.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameters.longDesc: The trim CAS (calibrated airspeed) of the vehicle. If an airspeed controller is active, this is the default airspeed setpoint that the controller will try to achieve if no other airspeed setpoint sources are present (e.g. through non-centered RC sticks).

parameters.name: FW_GND_SPD_MIN
parameters.longDesc: The controller will increase the commanded airspeed to maintain this minimum groundspeed to the next waypoint.

parameters.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The maximum pitch angle setpoint for autonomous modes including altitude and position control.

parameters.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameters.longDesc: The minimum pitch angle setpoint for autonomous modes including altitude and position control.

parameters.name: FW_THR_IDLE
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground For aircraft with internal combustion engines, this parameter should be set above the desired idle rpm. For electric motors, idle should typically be set to zero. Note that in automatic modes, "landed" conditions will engage idle throttle.

parameters.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For overpowered aircraft, this should be reduced to a value that provides sufficient thrust to climb at the maximum pitch angle PTCH_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For electric aircraft this will normally be set to zero, but can be set to a small non-zero value if a folding prop is fitted to prevent the prop from folding and unfolding repeatedly in-flight or to provide some aerodynamic drag from a turning prop to improve the descent rate. For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set for desired idle rpm.

parameters.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameters.name: FW_THR_TRIM
parameters.longDesc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve FW_AIRSPD_TRIM during level flight. Most airframes have a value of 0.5-0.7.

parameters.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand required to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than FW_THR_MAX, then either FW_T_CLMB_MAX should be increased or FW_THR_MAX reduced.

parameters.name: FW_T_CLMB_R_SP
parameters.longDesc: The default rate at which the vehicle will climb in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes this defines the maximum rate at which the altitude setpoint can be increased.

parameters.name: FW_T_I_GAIN_PIT
parameters.longDesc: This is the integrator gain on the pitch part of the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.

parameters.name: FW_T_I_GAIN_THR
parameters.longDesc: This is the integrator gain on the throttle part of the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.

parameters.name: FW_T_PTCH_DAMP
parameters.longDesc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.

parameters.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameters.longDesc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to  approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

parameters.name: FW_T_SEB_R_FF
parameters.shortDesc: Specific total energy balance rate feedforward gain

parameters.name: FW_T_SINK_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.

parameters.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameters.name: FW_T_SINK_R_SP
parameters.longDesc: The default rate at which the vehicle will sink in autonomous modes to achieve altitude setpoints. In manual modes this defines the maximum rate at which the altitude setpoint can be decreased.

parameters.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Note to Glider Pilots - set this parameter to 2.0 (The glider will adjust its pitch angle to maintain airspeed, ignoring changes in height).

parameters.name: FW_T_SPD_OMEGA
parameters.longDesc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain an improved airspeed estimate. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the airspeed sensor, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameters.name: FW_T_STE_R_TC
parameters.shortDesc: Specific total energy rate first order filter time constant
parameters.longDesc: This filter is applied to the specific total energy rate used for throttle damping.

parameters.name: FW_T_TAS_R_TC
parameters.shortDesc: True airspeed rate first order filter time constant
parameters.longDesc: This filter is applied to the true airspeed rate.

parameters.name: FW_T_THR_DAMP
parameters.longDesc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

parameters.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in m/s/s) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameters.name: FW_WIND_ARSP_SC
parameters.longDesc: Multiplying this factor with the current absolute wind estimate gives the airspeed offset added to the minimum airspeed setpoint limit. This helps to make the system more robust against disturbances (turbulence) in high wind. Only applies to AUTO flight mode. airspeed_min_adjusted = FW_AIRSPD_MIN + FW_WIND_ARSP_SC * wind.length()

parameters.name: FD_ACT_EN
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that for motors, a minimum amount of ESC current per throttle level is being consumed. Otherwise this indicates an motor failure.

parameters.name: FD_ACT_MOT_C2T
parameters.longDesc: Motor failure triggers only below this current value

parameters.name: FD_ACT_MOT_THR
parameters.longDesc: Motor failure triggers only above this throttle value.

parameters.name: FD_ACT_MOT_TOUT
parameters.longDesc: Motor failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time.

parameters.name: FD_ESCS_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable checks on ESCs that report their arming state
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, failure detector will verify that all the ESCs have successfully armed when the vehicle has transitioned to the armed state. Timeout for receiving an acknowledgement from the ESCs is 0.3s, if no feedback is received the failure detector will auto disarm the vehicle.

parameters.name: FD_EXT_ATS_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable PWM input on for engaging failsafe from an external automatic trigger system (ATS)
parameters.longDesc: Enabled on either AUX5 or MAIN5 depending on board. External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameters.name: FD_EXT_ATS_TRIG
parameters.shortDesc: The PWM threshold from external automatic trigger system for engaging failsafe
parameters.longDesc: External ATS is required by ASTM F3322-18.

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_P
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_P_TTRI
parameters.longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_R
parameters.longDesc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag. The flag triggers flight termination (if @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM = 0), which sets outputs to their failsafe values. On takeoff the flag triggers lockdown (irrespective of @CBRK_FLIGHTTERM), which disarms motors but does not set outputs to failsafe values. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameters.name: FD_FAIL_R_TTRI
parameters.longDesc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.

parameters.name: FD_IMB_PROP_THR
parameters.longDesc: Value at which the imbalanced propeller metric (based on horizontal and vertical acceleration variance) triggers a failure Setting this value to 0 disables the feature.

parameters.name: FLW_TGT_ALT_M
parameters.longDesc: Maintain altitude or track target's altitude. When maintaining the altitude, the drone can crash into terrain when the target moves uphill. When tracking the target's altitude, the follow altitude FLW_TGT_HT should be high enough to prevent terrain collisions due to GPS inaccuracies of the target.

values.description: 2D Tracking: Maintain constant altitude relative to home and track XY position only
2D + Terrain: Maintain constant altitude relative to terrain below and track XY position
3D Tracking: Track target's altitude (be aware that GPS altitude bias usually makes this useless)

parameters.name: FLW_TGT_DST
parameters.longDesc: The distance in meters to follow the target at

parameters.name: FLW_TGT_FA
parameters.longDesc: Angle to follow the target from. 0.0 Equals straight in front of the target's course (direction of motion) and the angle increases in clockwise direction, meaning Right-side would be 90.0 degrees while Left-side is -90.0 degrees Note: When the user force sets the angle out of the min/max range, it will be wrapped (e.g. 480 -> 120) in the range to gracefully handle the out of range.

parameters.name: FLW_TGT_HT
parameters.longDesc: Following height above the target

parameters.name: FLW_TGT_MAX_VEL
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum tangential velocity setting for generating the follow orbit trajectory
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum tangential velocity the drone will circle around the target whenever an orbit angle setpoint changes. Higher value means more aggressive follow behavior.

parameters.name: FLW_TGT_RS
parameters.shortDesc: Responsiveness to target movement in Target Estimator
parameters.longDesc: lower values increase the responsiveness to changing position, but also ignore less noise

parameters.name: GPS_1_GNSS
parameters.shortDesc: GNSS Systems for Primary GPS (integer bitmask)
parameters.longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS

parameters.name: GPS_1_PROTOCOL
parameters.longDesc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.

parameters.name: GPS_2_GNSS
parameters.shortDesc: GNSS Systems for Secondary GPS (integer bitmask)
parameters.longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set of GNSS systems used by the receiver. Check your receiver's documentation on how many systems are supported to be used in parallel. Currently this functionality is just implemented for u-blox receivers. When no bits are set, the receiver's default configuration should be used. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Use GPS (with QZSS) 1 : Use SBAS (multiple GPS augmentation systems) 2 : Use Galileo 3 : Use BeiDou 4 : Use GLONASS

parameters.name: GPS_2_PROTOCOL
parameters.longDesc: Select the GPS protocol over serial. Auto-detection will probe all protocols, and thus is a bit slower.

parameters.name: GPS_DUMP_COMM
parameters.longDesc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message. If this is set to 2, the main GPS is configured to output RTCM data, which is then logged as gps_dump and can be used for PPK.

parameters.name: GPS_SAT_INFO
parameters.longDesc: Enable publication of satellite info (ORB_ID(satellite_info)) if possible. Not available on MTK.

parameters.name: GPS_UBX_BAUD2
parameters.longDesc: Select a baudrate for the F9P's UART2 port. In GPS_UBX_MODE 1, 2, and 3, the F9P's UART2 port is configured to send/receive RTCM corrections. Set this to 57600 if you want to attach a telemetry radio on UART2.

parameters.name: GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL
parameters.longDesc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.

parameters.name: GPS_UBX_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Select the u-blox configuration setup. Most setups will use the default, including RTK and dual GPS without heading. If rover has RTCM corrections from a static base (or other static correction source) coming in on UART2, then select Mode 5. The Heading mode requires 2 F9P devices to be attached. The main GPS will act as rover and output heading information, whereas the secondary will act as moving base. Modes 1 and 2 require each F9P UART1 to be connected to the Autopilot. In addition, UART2 on the F9P units are connected to each other. Modes 3 and 4 only require UART1 on each F9P connected to the Autopilot or Can Node. UART RX DMA is required. RTK is still possible with this setup.

values.description: Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Moving Base)
Moving Base (UART1 Connected To Autopilot, UART2 Connected To Rover)
Heading (Rover With Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
Moving Base (Moving Base UART1 Connected to Autopilot Or Can Node At 921600)
Rover with Static Base on UART2 (similar to Default, except coming in on UART2)

parameters.name: GPS_YAW_OFFSET
parameters.shortDesc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameters.longDesc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the rover antenna is in front. The offset angle increases clockwise. Set this to 90 if the rover antenna is placed on the right side of the vehicle and the moving base antenna is on the left side.

parameters.name: GF_ACTION
parameters.longDesc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence.

parameters.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameters.longDesc: Select which altitude (AMSL) source should be used for geofence calculations.

values.description: Raw barometer altitude (assuming standard atmospheric pressure)

parameters.name: GF_COUNT
parameters.longDesc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameters.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameters.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameters.name: GF_PREDICT
parameters.longDesc: Predict the motion of the vehicle and trigger the breach if it is determined that the current trajectory would result in a breach happening before the vehicle can make evasive maneuvers. The vehicle is then re-routed to a safe hold position (stop for multirotor, loiter for fixed wing).

parameters.name: GF_SOURCE
parameters.longDesc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameters.name: CA_AIRFRAME
parameters.longDesc: Defines which mixer implementation to use. Some are generic, while others are specifically fit to a certain vehicle with a fixed set of actuators. 'Custom' should only be used if noting else can be used.

parameters.name: CA_FAILURE_MODE
parameters.longDesc: This is used to specify how to handle motor failures reported by failure detector.

values.description: Remove first failed motor from effectiveness

parameters.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C0
parameters.longDesc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 0 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C1
parameters.longDesc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 1 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C2
parameters.longDesc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 2 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C3
parameters.longDesc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 3 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_PITCH_C4
parameters.longDesc: Defines the collective pitch at the interval position 4 for a given thrust setpoint. Use negative values if the swash plate needs to move down to provide upwards thrust.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_THR_C0
parameters.longDesc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 0.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_THR_C1
parameters.longDesc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 1.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_THR_C2
parameters.longDesc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 2.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_THR_C3
parameters.longDesc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 3.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_THR_C4
parameters.longDesc: Defines the output throttle at the interval position 4.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_YAW_CCW
parameters.longDesc: Default configuration is for a clockwise turning main rotor and positive thrust of the tail rotor is expected to rotate the vehicle clockwise. Set this parameter to true if the tail rotor provides thrust in counter-clockwise direction which is mostly the case when the main rotor turns counter-clockwise.

parameters.name: CA_HELI_YAW_CP_S
parameters.shortDesc: Scale for yaw compensation based on collective pitch
parameters.longDesc: This allows to add a proportional factor of the collective pitch command to the yaw command. A negative value is needed when positive thrust of the tail rotor rotates the vehicle opposite to the main rotor turn direction. tail_output += CA_HELI_YAW_CP_S * collective_pitch

parameters.name: CA_HELI_YAW_TH_S
parameters.shortDesc: Scale for yaw compensation based on throttle
parameters.longDesc: This allows to add a proportional factor of the throttle command to the yaw command. A negative value is needed when positive thrust of the tail rotor rotates the vehicle opposite to the main rotor turn direction. tail_output += CA_HELI_YAW_TH_S * throttle

parameters.name: CA_METHOD
parameters.longDesc: Selects the algorithm and desaturation method. If set to Automtic, the selection is based on the airframe (CA_AIRFRAME).

parameters.name: CA_R0_SLEW
parameters.longDesc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through the full output range. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 0 to 1 in minimum x seconds (in case of reversible motors, the range is -1 to 1). Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameters.name: CA_R10_SLEW
parameters.longDesc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through the full output range. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 0 to 1 in minimum x seconds (in case of reversible motors, the range is -1 to 1). Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameters.longDesc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_AY
parameters.shortDesc: Axis of rotor 0 thrust vector, Y body axis component

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_AZ

parameters.longDesc: Only the direction is considered (the vector is normalized).

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_CT
parameters.longDesc: The thrust coefficient if defined as Thrust = CT * u^2, where u (with value between actuator minimum and maximum) is the output signal sent to the motor controller.

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_KM
parameters.longDesc: The moment coefficient if defined as Torque = KM * Thrust. Use a positive value for a rotor with CCW rotation. Use a negative value for a rotor with CW rotation.

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_PX

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_PY

parameters.name: CA_ROTOR0_TILT

parameters.name: CA_SV_TL0_CT
parameters.longDesc: Define if this servo is used for additional control.

parameters.name: CA_SV_TL0_MAXA
parameters.shortDesc: Tilt Servo 0 Tilt Angle at Maximum
parameters.longDesc: Defines the tilt angle when the servo is at the maximum. An angle of zero means upwards.

parameters.name: CA_SV_TL0_MINA
parameters.shortDesc: Tilt Servo 0 Tilt Angle at Minimum
parameters.longDesc: Defines the tilt angle when the servo is at the minimum. An angle of zero means upwards.

parameters.name: CA_SV_TL0_TD
parameters.longDesc: Defines the direction the servo tilts towards when moving towards the maximum tilt angle. For example if the minimum tilt angle is -90, the maximum 90, and the direction 'Towards Front', the motor axis aligns with the XZ-plane, points towards -X at the minimum and +X at the maximum tilt.

parameters.name: HTE_ACC_GATE
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: HTE_HT_ERR_INIT
parameters.longDesc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameters.name: HTE_HT_NOISE
parameters.longDesc: Reduce to make the hover thrust estimate more stable, increase if the real hover thrust is expected to change quickly over time.

parameters.name: HTE_THR_RANGE
parameters.longDesc: Defines the range of the hover thrust estimate around MPC_THR_HOVER. A value of 0.2 with MPC_THR_HOVER at 0.5 results in a range of [0.3, 0.7]. Set to a large value if the vehicle operates in varying physical conditions that affect the required hover thrust strongly (e.g. differently sized payloads).

parameters.name: HTE_VXY_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Horizontal velocity threshold for sensitivity reduction
parameters.longDesc: Above this speed, the measurement noise is linearly increased to reduce the sensitivity of the estimator from biased measurement. Set to a low value on vehicles with large lifting surfaces.

parameters.name: HTE_VZ_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Vertical velocity threshold for sensitivity reduction
parameters.longDesc: Above this speed, the measurement noise is linearly increased to reduce the sensitivity of the estimator from biased measurement. Set to a low value on vehicles affected by air drag when climbing or descending.

parameters.name: LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state

parameters.name: LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max horizontal velocity threshold
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state. A factor of 0.7 is applied in case of airspeed-less flying (either because no sensor is present or sensor data got invalid in flight).

parameters.name: LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max vertiacal velocity threshold
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state. A factor of 0.7 is applied in case of airspeed-less flying (either because no sensor is present or sensor data got invalid in flight).

parameters.name: LNDFW_XYACC_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Fixed-wing land detector: Max horizontal acceleration
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal (x,y body axes) acceleration allowed in the landed state

parameters.name: LNDMC_ALT_GND
parameters.longDesc: The height above ground below which ground effect creates barometric altitude errors. A negative value indicates no ground effect.

parameters.name: LNDMC_ALT_MAX
parameters.longDesc: The system will obey this limit as a hard altitude limit. This setting will be consolidated with the GF_MAX_VER_DIST parameter. A negative value indicates no altitude limitation.

parameters.name: LNDMC_ROT_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum allowed angular velocity around each axis allowed in the landed state.

parameters.name: LNDMC_TRIG_TIME
parameters.longDesc: Total time it takes to go through all three land detection stages: ground contact, maybe landed, landed when all necessary conditions are constantly met.

parameters.name: LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state

parameters.name: LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state

parameters.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_HI
parameters.longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Higher 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameters.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_LO
parameters.longDesc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Lower 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameters.name: LTEST_SENS_POS_X
parameters.shortDesc: X Position of IRLOCK in body frame (forward)

parameters.name: LTEST_SENS_POS_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Y Position of IRLOCK in body frame (right)

parameters.name: LTEST_SENS_POS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Z Position of IRLOCK in body frame (downward)

parameters.name: LTEST_SENS_ROT
parameters.shortDesc: Rotation of IRLOCK sensor relative to airframe
parameters.longDesc: Default orientation of Yaw 90°

parameters.name: LTEST_ACC_UNC
parameters.longDesc: Variance of acceleration measurement used for landing target position prediction. Higher values results in tighter following of the measurements and more lenient outlier rejection

parameters.name: LTEST_MEAS_UNC
parameters.longDesc: Variance of the landing target measurement from the driver. Higher values result in less aggressive following of the measurement and a smoother output as well as fewer rejected measurements.

parameters.name: LTEST_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Configure the mode of the landing target. Depending on the mode, the landing target observations are used differently to aid position estimation. Mode Moving:     The landing target may be moving around while in the field of view of the vehicle. Landing target measurements are not used to aid positioning. Mode Stationary: The landing target is stationary. Measured velocity w.r.t. the landing target is used to aid velocity estimation.

parameters.name: LTEST_POS_UNC_IN
parameters.longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target position in x and y direction

parameters.name: LTEST_SCALE_X
parameters.shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor x axis
parameters.longDesc: Landing target x measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameters.name: LTEST_SCALE_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor y axis
parameters.longDesc: Landing target y measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameters.name: LTEST_VEL_UNC_IN
parameters.longDesc: Initial variance of the relative landing target velocity in x and y directions

parameters.name: LPE_ACC_XY
parameters.longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz) Larger than data sheet to account for tilt error.

parameters.name: LPE_ACC_Z
parameters.longDesc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz)

parameters.name: LPE_BAR_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation

parameters.name: LPE_EPH_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max EPH allowed for GPS initialization

parameters.name: LPE_EPV_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max EPV allowed for GPS initialization

parameters.name: LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow)
parameters.longDesc: By initializing the estimator to the LPE_LAT/LON parameters when global information is unavailable

parameters.name: LPE_FGYRO_HP
parameters.shortDesc: Flow gyro high pass filter cut off frequency

parameters.name: LPE_FLW_OFF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow z offset from center

parameters.name: LPE_FLW_RR
parameters.shortDesc: Optical flow angular velocity noise gain

parameters.name: LPE_FUSION
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to fuse GPS data if available, also requires GPS for altitude init 1 : Set to true to fuse optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to fuse vision position 3 : Set to true to enable landing target 4 : Set to true to fuse land detector 5 : Set to true to publish AGL as local position down component 6 : Set to true to enable flow gyro compensation 7 : Set to true to enable baro fusion default (145 - GPS, baro, land detector)

bitmask.description: fuse GPS, requires GPS for alt. init

parameters.name: LPE_GPS_VXY
parameters.longDesc: EPV used if greater than this value.

parameters.name: LPE_GPS_XY
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum GPS xy standard deviation, uses reported EPH if greater

parameters.name: LPE_GPS_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum GPS z standard deviation, uses reported EPV if greater

parameters.name: LPE_LAND_VXY
parameters.shortDesc: Land detector xy velocity standard deviation

parameters.name: LPE_LAT
parameters.shortDesc: Local origin latitude for nav w/o GPS

parameters.name: LPE_LDR_OFF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Lidar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameters.name: LPE_LON
parameters.shortDesc: Local origin longitude for nav w/o GPS

parameters.name: LPE_LT_COV
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater

parameters.name: LPE_PN_P
parameters.longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameters.name: LPE_PN_T
parameters.shortDesc: Terrain random walk noise density, hilly/outdoor (0.1), flat/Indoor (0.001)

parameters.name: LPE_PN_V
parameters.longDesc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameters.name: LPE_SNR_OFF_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Sonar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameters.name: LPE_T_MAX_GRADE
parameters.shortDesc: Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg)
parameters.longDesc: Used to calculate increased terrain random walk nosie due to movement.

parameters.name: LPE_VIS_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: Set to zero to enable automatic compensation from measurement timestamps

parameters.name: LPE_VXY_PUB
parameters.shortDesc: Required velocity xy standard deviation to publish position

parameters.name: LPE_Z_PUB
parameters.shortDesc: Required z standard deviation to publish altitude/ terrain

parameters.name: MAV_0_BROADCAST
parameters.shortDesc: Broadcast heartbeats on local network for MAVLink instance 0
parameters.longDesc: This allows a ground control station to automatically find the drone on the local network.

parameters.name: MAV_0_FLOW_CTRL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable serial flow control for instance 0
parameters.longDesc: This is used to force flow control on or off for the the mavlink instance. By default it is auto detected. Use when auto detection fails.

parameters.name: MAV_0_FORWARD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 0
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameters.name: MAV_0_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameters.name: MAV_0_RADIO_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable software throttling of mavlink on instance 0
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, MAVLink messages will be throttled according to `txbuf` field reported by radio_status. Requires a radio to send the mavlink message RADIO_STATUS.

parameters.name: MAV_0_RATE
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 0
parameters.longDesc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameters.name: MAV_0_REMOTE_PRT
parameters.longDesc: If ethernet enabled and selected as configuration for MAVLink instance 0, selected remote port will be set and used in MAVLink instance 0.

parameters.name: MAV_0_UDP_PRT
parameters.longDesc: If ethernet enabled and selected as configuration for MAVLink instance 0, selected udp port will be set and used in MAVLink instance 0.

parameters.name: MAV_1_BROADCAST
parameters.shortDesc: Broadcast heartbeats on local network for MAVLink instance 1
parameters.longDesc: This allows a ground control station to automatically find the drone on the local network.

parameters.name: MAV_1_FLOW_CTRL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable serial flow control for instance 1
parameters.longDesc: This is used to force flow control on or off for the the mavlink instance. By default it is auto detected. Use when auto detection fails.

parameters.name: MAV_1_FORWARD
parameters.shortDesc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 1
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameters.name: MAV_1_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameters.name: MAV_1_RADIO_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable software throttling of mavlink on instance 1
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, MAVLink messages will be throttled according to `txbuf` field reported by radio_status. Requires a radio to send the mavlink message RADIO_STATUS.

This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameters.name: MAV_1_REMOTE_PRT
parameters.longDesc: If ethernet enabled and selected as configuration for MAVLink instance 1, selected remote port will be set and used in MAVLink instance 1.

parameters.name: MAV_1_UDP_PRT

parameters.name: MAV_2_RADIO_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable software throttling of mavlink on instance 2
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, MAVLink messages will be throttled according to `txbuf` field reported by radio_status. Requires a radio to send the mavlink message RADIO_STATUS.

parameters.name: MAV_2_RATE
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 2
parameters.longDesc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameters.name: MAV_2_REMOTE_PRT
parameters.longDesc: If ethernet enabled and selected as configuration for MAVLink instance 2, selected remote port will be set and used in MAVLink instance 2.

parameters.name: MAV_2_UDP_PRT
parameters.longDesc: If ethernet enabled and selected as configuration for MAVLink instance 2, selected udp port will be set and used in MAVLink instance 2.

parameters.name: MAV_FWDEXTSP
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1 incoming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode

parameters.name: MAV_HASH_CHK_EN
parameters.longDesc: Disabling the parameter hash check functionality will make the mavlink instance stream parameters continuously.

parameters.name: MAV_HB_FORW_EN
parameters.longDesc: The mavlink heartbeat message will not be forwarded if this parameter is set to 'disabled'. The main reason for disabling heartbeats to be forwarded is because they confuse dronekit.

parameters.name: MAV_ODOM_LP
parameters.longDesc: If set, it gets the data from 'vehicle_visual_odometry' instead of 'vehicle_odometry' serving as a loopback of the received ODOMETRY messages on the Mavlink receiver.

values.description: Default to 1, switch to 2 if GCS sends version 2

parameters.name: MAV_RADIO_TOUT
parameters.shortDesc: Timeout in seconds for the RADIO_STATUS reports coming in
parameters.longDesc: If the connected radio stops reporting RADIO_STATUS for a certain time, a warning is triggered and, if MAV_X_RADIO_CTL is enabled, the software-flow control is reset.

parameters.name: MAV_SIK_RADIO_ID
parameters.longDesc: When non-zero the MAVLink app will attempt to configure the SiK radio to this ID and re-set the parameter to 0. If the value is negative it will reset the complete radio config to factory defaults. Only applies if this mavlink instance is going through a SiK radio

values.description: VTOL Standard (separate fixed rotors for hover and cruise flight)

parameters.name: MAV_USEHILGPS
parameters.shortDesc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message even if not in HIL mode
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1 incoming HIL GPS messages are parsed.

parameters.name: MBE_ENABLE
parameters.longDesc: This enables continuous calibration of the magnetometers before takeoff using gyro data.

parameters.name: MBE_LEARN_GAIN
parameters.longDesc: Increase to make the estimator more responsive Decrease to make the estimator more robust to noise

parameters.name: MAN_ARM_GESTURE
parameters.longDesc: This determines if moving the left stick to the lower right arms and to the lower left disarms the vehicle.

parameters.name: FW_GPSF_LT
parameters.longDesc: The time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for GPS recovery before it starts descending. Set to 0 to disable. Roll angle is set to FW_GPSF_R. Does only apply for fixed-wing vehicles or VTOLs with NAV_FORCE_VT set to 0.

parameters.name: FW_GPSF_R
parameters.longDesc: Roll in degrees during the loiter after the vehicle has lost GPS in an auto mode (e.g. mission or loiter). Does only apply for fixed-wing vehicles or VTOLs with NAV_FORCE_VT set to 0.

parameters.name: MIS_DIST_1WP
parameters.shortDesc: Maximal horizontal distance from home to first waypoint
parameters.longDesc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIST_1WP from the home position.

parameters.name: MIS_DIST_WPS
parameters.longDesc: Failsafe check to prevent running missions which are way too big. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if any distance between two subsequent waypoints is greater than MIS_DIST_WPS.

parameters.name: MIS_LTRMIN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum altitude the system will always obey. The intent is to stay out of ground effect. set to -1, if there shouldn't be a minimum loiter altitude

parameters.name: MIS_MNT_YAW_CTL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable yaw control of the mount. (Only affects multicopters and ROI mission items)
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, yaw commands will be sent to the mount and the vehicle will follow its heading towards the flight direction. If disabled, the vehicle will yaw towards the ROI.

parameters.name: MIS_PD_TO
parameters.shortDesc: Timeout for a successful payload deployment acknowledgement

parameters.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum altitude the system will take off to.

parameters.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_REQ
parameters.longDesc: If set, the mission feasibility checker will check for a takeoff waypoint on the mission.

parameters.name: MIS_YAW_ERR
parameters.shortDesc: Max yaw error in degrees needed for waypoint heading acceptance

parameters.name: MIS_YAW_TMT
parameters.shortDesc: Time in seconds we wait on reaching target heading at a waypoint if it is forced
parameters.longDesc: If set > 0 it will ignore the target heading for normal waypoint acceptance. If the waypoint forces the heading the timeout will matter. For example on VTOL forwards transition. Mainly useful for VTOLs that have less yaw authority and might not reach target yaw in wind. Disabled by default.

parameters.name: MPC_YAW_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Specifies the heading in Auto.

parameters.name: NAV_ACC_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set. For fixed wing the L1 turning distance is used for horizontal acceptance.

parameters.name: NAV_FORCE_VT
parameters.shortDesc: Force VTOL mode takeoff and land

parameters.name: NAV_FW_ALTL_RAD
parameters.shortDesc: FW Altitude Acceptance Radius before a landing
parameters.longDesc: Altitude acceptance used for the last waypoint before a fixed-wing landing. This is usually smaller than the standard vertical acceptance because close to the ground higher accuracy is required.

parameters.name: NAV_FW_ALT_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Acceptance radius for fixedwing altitude.

parameters.name: NAV_LOITER_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, Hold mode, Return mode, etc. (fixedwing only).

parameters.name: NAV_MC_ALT_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Acceptance radius for multicopter altitude.

parameters.name: NAV_TRAFF_AVOID
parameters.longDesc: Enabling this will allow the system to respond to transponder data from e.g. ADSB transponders

parameters.name: NAV_TRAFF_A_RADM
parameters.shortDesc: Set NAV TRAFFIC AVOID RADIUS MANNED
parameters.longDesc: Defines the Radius where NAV TRAFFIC AVOID is Called For Manned Aviation

parameters.name: NAV_TRAFF_A_RADU
parameters.longDesc: Defines the Radius where NAV TRAFFIC AVOID is Called For Unmanned Aviation

parameters.name: WEIGHT_BASE
parameters.longDesc: This is the weight of the vehicle at which it's performance limits were derived. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameters.name: WEIGHT_GROSS
parameters.longDesc: This is the actual weight of the vehicle at any time. This value will differ from WEIGHT_BASE in case weight was added or removed from the base weight. Examples are the addition of payloads or larger batteries. A zero or negative value disables trim throttle and minimum airspeed compensation based on weight.

parameters.name: MC_AIRMODE
parameters.longDesc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.

parameters.name: MNT_DO_STAB
parameters.longDesc: Set to true for servo gimbal, false for passthrough. This is required for a gimbal which is not capable of stabilizing itself and relies on the IMU's attitude estimation.

parameters.name: MNT_MAN_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control pitch (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameters.name: MNT_MAN_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control roll (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameters.name: MNT_MAN_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Auxiliary channel to control yaw (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameters.name: MNT_MAV_COMPID
parameters.shortDesc: Mavlink Component ID of the mount
parameters.longDesc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLink protocol v2, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this component ID.

parameters.name: MNT_MAV_SYSID
parameters.shortDesc: Mavlink System ID of the mount
parameters.longDesc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLink gimbal protocol v1, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this target ID.

parameters.name: MNT_MODE_IN
parameters.longDesc: This is the protocol used between the ground station and the autopilot. Recommended is Auto, RC only or MAVLink gimbal protocol v2. The rest will be deprecated.

values.description: Auto (RC and MAVLink gimbal protocol v2)

parameters.name: MNT_MODE_OUT
parameters.longDesc: This is the protocol used between the autopilot and a connected gimbal. Recommended is the MAVLink gimbal protocol v2 if the gimbal supports it.

parameters.name: MNT_OB_LOCK_MODE
parameters.shortDesc: Mixer value for selecting a locking mode
parameters.longDesc: if required for the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_OB_NORM_MODE
parameters.shortDesc: Mixer value for selecting normal mode
parameters.longDesc: if required by the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_OFF_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Offset for pitch channel output in degrees

parameters.name: MNT_OFF_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Offset for roll channel output in degrees

parameters.name: MNT_OFF_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Offset for yaw channel output in degrees

parameters.name: MNT_RANGE_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Range of pitch channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_RANGE_ROLL
parameters.shortDesc: Range of roll channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_RANGE_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Range of yaw channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameters.name: MNT_RATE_PITCH
parameters.shortDesc: Angular pitch rate for manual input in degrees/second
parameters.longDesc: Full stick input [-1..1] translats to [-pitch rate..pitch rate].

parameters.name: MNT_RATE_YAW
parameters.shortDesc: Angular yaw rate for manual input in degrees/second
parameters.longDesc: Full stick input [-1..1] translats to [-yaw rate..yaw rate].

parameters.name: MNT_RC_IN_MODE
parameters.shortDesc: Input mode for RC gimbal input

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Limit for pitch rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameters.name: MC_PITCH_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Limit for roll rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameters.name: MC_ROLL_P
parameters.longDesc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameters.name: MC_YAW_P
parameters.longDesc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameters.name: MC_YAW_WEIGHT
parameters.longDesc: A fraction [0,1] deprioritizing yaw compared to roll and pitch in non-linear attitude control. Deprioritizing yaw is necessary because multicopters have much less control authority in yaw compared to the other axes and it makes sense because yaw is not critical for stable hovering or 3D navigation. For yaw control tuning use MC_YAW_P. This ratio has no impact on the yaw gain.

parameters.name: MPC_YAWRAUTO_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max yaw rate in auto mode
parameters.longDesc: Limit the rate of change of the yaw setpoint in autonomous mode to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameters.name: CP_DELAY
parameters.shortDesc: Average delay of the range sensor message plus the tracking delay of the position controller in seconds
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode.

parameters.name: CP_DIST
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidance is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value

parameters.name: CP_GO_NO_DATA
parameters.shortDesc: Boolean to allow moving into directions where there is no sensor data (outside FOV)
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode.

parameters.name: CP_GUIDE_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint by which the collision prevention algorithm can choose to change the setpoint direction
parameters.longDesc: Only used in Position mode.

parameters.name: MC_MAN_TILT_TAU
parameters.shortDesc: Manual tilt input filter time constant
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_DOWN_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes down

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_HOR
parameters.shortDesc: Acceleration for auto and for manual
parameters.longDesc: Note: In manual, this parameter is only used in MPC_POS_MODE 4.

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal acceleration for auto mode and for manual mode
parameters.longDesc: MPC_POS_MODE 1 just deceleration 3 acceleration and deceleration 4 just acceleration

parameters.name: MPC_ACC_UP_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes upward

parameters.name: MPC_ALT_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Set to 0 to control height relative to the earth frame origin. This origin may move up and down in flight due to sensor drift. Set to 1 to control height relative to estimated distance to ground. The vehicle will move up and down with terrain height variation. Requires a distance to ground sensor. The height controller will revert to using height above origin if the distance to ground estimate becomes invalid as indicated by the local_position.distance_bottom_valid message being false. Set to 2 to control height relative to ground (requires a distance sensor) when stationary and relative to earth frame origin when moving horizontally. The speed threshold is controlled by the MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY parameter.

parameters.name: MPC_HOLD_DZ
parameters.shortDesc: Deadzone of sticks where position hold is enabled

parameters.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameters.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_Z
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameters.name: MPC_JERK_AUTO
parameters.longDesc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility.

parameters.name: MPC_JERK_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility (how fast it can change directions or break). Setting this to the maximum value essentially disables the limit. Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to a smoothing mode 3 or 4.

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_ALT1
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude for 1. step of slow landing (descend)
parameters.longDesc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to a value between "MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN" (or "MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN") and "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be higher than "MPC_LAND_ALT2"

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_ALT2
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude for 2. step of slow landing (landing)
parameters.longDesc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be lower than "MPC_LAND_ALT1"

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_ALT3
parameters.shortDesc: Altitude for 3. step of slow landing
parameters.longDesc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_CRWL", if LIDAR available. No effect if LIDAR not available

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_CRWL
parameters.shortDesc: Land crawl descend rate. Used below

parameters.name: MPC_MANTHR_MIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. With MC_AIRMODE set to 1, this can safely be set to 0.

parameters.name: MPC_MAN_TILT_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximal tilt angle in manual or altitude mode

parameters.name: MPC_MAN_Y_TAU
parameters.shortDesc: Manual yaw rate input filter time constant
parameters.longDesc: Setting this parameter to 0 disables the filter

parameters.name: MPC_POS_MODE
parameters.longDesc: The supported sub-modes are: 0 Simple position control where sticks map directly to velocity setpoints without smoothing. Useful for velocity control tuning. 3 Smooth position control with maximum acceleration and jerk limits based on jerk optimized trajectory generator (different algorithm than 1). 4 Smooth position control where sticks map to acceleration and there's a virtual brake drag

parameters.name: MPC_THR_CURVE
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines how the throttle stick input is mapped to commanded thrust in Manual/Stabilized flight mode. In case the default is used ('Rescale to hover thrust'), the stick input is linearly rescaled, such that a centered stick corresponds to the hover throttle (see MPC_THR_HOVER). Select 'No Rescale' to directly map the stick 1:1 to the output. This can be useful in case the hover thrust is very low and the default would lead to too much distortion (e.g. if hover thrust is set to 20%, 80% of the upper thrust range is squeezed into the upper half of the stick range). Note: In case MPC_THR_HOVER is set to 50%, the modes 0 and 1 are the same.

parameters.name: MPC_THR_HOVER
parameters.longDesc: Vertical thrust required to hover. This value is mapped to center stick for manual throttle control. With this value set to the thrust required to hover, transition from manual to Altitude or Position mode while hovering will occur with the throttle stick near center, which is then interpreted as (near) zero demand for vertical speed. This parameter is also important for the landing detection to work correctly.

parameters.name: MPC_THR_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum thrust in auto thrust control
parameters.longDesc: Limit max allowed thrust

parameters.name: MPC_THR_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum collective thrust in auto thrust control
parameters.longDesc: It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. Note: Without airmode zero thrust leads to zero roll/pitch control authority. (see MC_AIRMODE)

parameters.name: MPC_THR_XY_MARG
parameters.longDesc: Margin that is kept for horizontal control when prioritizing vertical thrust. To avoid completely starving horizontal control with high vertical error.

parameters.name: MPC_TILTMAX_AIR
parameters.longDesc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameters.name: MPC_TILTMAX_LND
parameters.longDesc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameters.name: MPC_TKO_RAMP_T
parameters.shortDesc: Position control smooth takeoff ramp time constant
parameters.longDesc: Increasing this value will make automatic and manual takeoff slower. If it's too slow the drone might scratch the ground and tip over. A time constant of 0 disables the ramp

parameters.name: MPC_USE_HTE
parameters.longDesc: Set false to use the fixed parameter MPC_THR_HOVER Set true to use the value computed by the hover thrust estimator

parameters.name: MPC_VELD_LP
parameters.shortDesc: Low pass filter cut freq. for numerical velocity derivative

parameters.name: MPC_VEL_MANUAL
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity setpoint in Position mode
parameters.longDesc: If velocity setpoint larger than MPC_XY_VEL_MAX is set, then the setpoint will be capped to MPC_XY_VEL_MAX The maximum sideways and backward speed can be set differently using MPC_VEL_MAN_SIDE and MPC_VEL_MAN_BACK, respectively.

parameters.name: MPC_VEL_MAN_BACK
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum backward velocity in Position mode
parameters.longDesc: If set to a negative value or larger than MPC_VEL_MANUAL then MPC_VEL_MANUAL is used.

parameters.name: MPC_VEL_MAN_SIDE
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum sideways velocity in Position mode
parameters.longDesc: If set to a negative value or larger than MPC_VEL_MANUAL then MPC_VEL_MANUAL is used.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_CRUISE
parameters.longDesc: Horizontal velocity used when flying autonomously in e.g. Missions, RTL, Goto.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_ERR_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum horizontal error allowed by the trajectory generator
parameters.longDesc: The integration speed of the trajectory setpoint is linearly reduced with the horizontal position tracking error. When the error is above this parameter, the integration of the trajectory is stopped to wait for the drone. This value can be adjusted depending on the tracking capabilities of the vehicle.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_MAN_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Manual position control stick exponential curve sensitivity
parameters.longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MPC_XY_P
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameters.name: MPC_XY_TRAJ_P
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal trajectory position error

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_ALL
parameters.longDesc: If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as MPC_XY_VEL_MAX or MPC_VEL_MANUAL). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_D_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_I_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non-zero value allows to eliminate steady state errors in the presence of disturbances like wind.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameters.longDesc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode. If higher speeds are commanded in a mission they will be capped to this velocity.

parameters.name: MPC_XY_VEL_P_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error

parameters.name: MPC_YAW_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Manual control stick yaw rotation exponential curve
parameters.longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MPC_Z_MAN_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Manual control stick vertical exponential curve
parameters.longDesc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MPC_Z_P
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_ALL
parameters.longDesc: If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP or MPC_LAND_SPEED). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_D_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s^2 velocity derivative

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_I_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m velocity integral Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN
parameters.longDesc: Descent velocity in manual modes and offboard. For auto modes, see MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP
parameters.longDesc: Ascent velocity in manual modes and offboard. For auto modes, see MPC_Z_V_AUTO_UP

parameters.name: MPC_Z_VEL_P_ACC
parameters.shortDesc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error
parameters.longDesc: defined as correction acceleration in m/s^2 per m/s velocity error

parameters.name: MPC_Z_V_AUTO_DN
parameters.longDesc: Descent velocity in auto modes. For manual modes and offboard, see MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN

parameters.name: MPC_Z_V_AUTO_UP
parameters.longDesc: Ascent velocity in auto modes. For manual modes and offboard, see MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP

parameters.name: SYS_VEHICLE_RESP
parameters.longDesc: Changes the overall responsiveness of the vehicle. The higher the value, the faster the vehicle will react. If set to a value greater than zero, other parameters are automatically set (such as the acceleration or jerk limits). If set to a negative value, the existing individual parameters are used.

parameters.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameters.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode Expo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameters.longDesc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode Expo factor for Yaw
parameters.longDesc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_P_MAX
parameters.longDesc: default: 2 turns per second

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_R_MAX
parameters.longDesc: default: 2 turns per second

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPO
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameters.longDesc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 reasonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPOY
parameters.shortDesc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Yaw
parameters.longDesc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 reasonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameters.name: MC_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameters.longDesc: default 1.5 turns per second

parameters.name: MC_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameters.longDesc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The copter should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max acceleration at lower battery percentages. i.e. if hover is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_D
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_FF
parameters.longDesc: Improves tracking performance.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_I
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_K
parameters.longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_PITCHRATE_K * (MC_PITCHRATE_P * error + MC_PITCHRATE_I * error_integral + MC_PITCHRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_PITCHRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_PITCHRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameters.name: MC_PITCHRATE_P
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: MC_PR_INT_LIM
parameters.longDesc: Pitch rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large pitch moment trim changes.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_D
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_FF
parameters.longDesc: Improves tracking performance.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_I
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_K
parameters.longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_ROLLRATE_K * (MC_ROLLRATE_P * error + MC_ROLLRATE_I * error_integral + MC_ROLLRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_ROLLRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_ROLLRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameters.name: MC_ROLLRATE_P
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: MC_RR_INT_LIM
parameters.longDesc: Roll rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large roll moment trim changes.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_D
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_FF
parameters.longDesc: Improves tracking performance.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_I
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_K
parameters.longDesc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_YAWRATE_K * (MC_YAWRATE_P * error + MC_YAWRATE_I * error_integral + MC_YAWRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_YAWRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_YAWRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameters.name: MC_YAWRATE_P
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameters.name: MC_YR_INT_LIM
parameters.longDesc: Yaw rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large yaw moment trim changes.

parameters.name: OSD_DWELL_TIME
parameters.longDesc: Amount of time in milliseconds to dwell at the beginning of the display, when scrolling.

parameters.name: OSD_LOG_LEVEL
parameters.longDesc: Minimum security of log level to display on the OSD.

parameters.name: OSD_SCROLL_RATE
parameters.longDesc: Scroll rate in milliseconds for OSD messages longer than available character width. This is lower-bounded by the nominal loop rate of this module.

parameters.name: OSD_SYMBOLS
parameters.longDesc: Configure / toggle support display options.

parameters.name: MOT_SLEW_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum motor rise time (slew rate limit)
parameters.longDesc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through a range of 1000 PWM units. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 1000 to 2000 PWM in minimum x seconds. Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameters.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameters.shortDesc: Thrust to motor control signal model parameter
parameters.longDesc: Parameter used to model the nonlinear relationship between motor control signal (e.g. PWM) and static thrust. The model is: rel_thrust = factor * rel_signal^2 + (1-factor) * rel_signal, where rel_thrust is the normalized thrust between 0 and 1, and rel_signal is the relative motor control signal between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: PD_GRIPPER_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable Gripper actuation in Payload Deliverer

parameters.name: PD_GRIPPER_TO
parameters.shortDesc: Timeout for successful gripper actuation acknowledgement
parameters.longDesc: Maximum time Gripper will wait while the successful griper actuation isn't recognised. If the gripper has no feedback sensor, it will simply wait for this time before considering gripper actuation successful and publish a 'vehicle_command_ack' signaling successful gripper action

parameters.name: PLD_BTOUT
parameters.longDesc: Time after which the landing target is considered lost without any new measurements.

parameters.name: PLD_FAPPR_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Allow final approach (without horizontal positioning) if losing landing target closer than this to the ground.

parameters.name: PLD_HACC_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Start descending if closer above landing target than this.

parameters.name: PLD_MAX_SRCH
parameters.longDesc: Maximum number of times to search for the landing target if it is lost during the precision landing.

parameters.name: PLD_SRCH_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Altitude above home to which to climb when searching for the landing target.

parameters.name: PLD_SRCH_TOUT
parameters.longDesc: Time allowed to search for the landing target before falling back to normal landing.
