parameters.name: RC_CHAN_CNT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter is used by Ground Station software to save the number of channels which were used during RC calibration. It is only meant for ground station use.

parameters.name: RC_FAILS_THR
parameters.longDesc: Use RC_MAP_FAILSAFE to specify which channel is used to indicate RC loss via this threshold. By default this is the throttle channel. Set to a PWM value slightly above the PWM value for the channel (e.g. throttle) in a failsafe event, but below the minimum PWM value for the channel during normal operation. Note: The default value of 0 disables the feature (it is below the expected range).

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX1
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera pitch

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX2
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera roll

parameters.name: RC_MAP_AUX3
parameters.longDesc: Default function: Camera azimuth / yaw

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ENG_MOT
parameters.shortDesc: RC channel to engage the main motor (for helicopters)

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FAILSAFE
parameters.longDesc: Configures which RC channel is used by the receiver to indicate the signal was lost (on receivers that use output a fixed signal value to report lost signal). If set to 0, the channel mapped to throttle is used. Use RC_FAILS_THR to set the threshold indicating lost signal. By default it's below the expected range and hence disabled.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM1
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 1st parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM2
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 2nd parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PARAM3
parameters.longDesc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 3th parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameters.name: RC_MAP_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_THROTTLE
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_YAW
parameters.longDesc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN
parameters.shortDesc: PWM input channel that provides RSSI
parameters.longDesc: 0: do not read RSSI from input channel 1-18: read RSSI from specified input channel Specify the range for RSSI input with RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN and RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX parameters.

parameters.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Max input value for RSSI reading
parameters.longDesc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameters.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Min input value for RSSI reading
parameters.longDesc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameters.name: TRIM_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: TRIM_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: TRIM_YAW
parameters.longDesc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameters.name: RC_ARMSWITCH_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_ENG_MOT_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for selecting main motor engage
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_GEAR_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for the landing gear switch
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_KILLSWITCH_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_LOITER_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_MAP_ARM_SW
parameters.longDesc: Use it to arm/disarm via switch instead of default throttle stick. If this is assigned, arming and disarming via stick is disabled.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FLTMODE
parameters.longDesc: If this parameter is non-zero, flight modes are only selected by this channel and are assigned to six slots.

parameters.name: RC_MAP_FLTM_BTN
parameters.longDesc: This bitmask allows to specify multiple channels for changing flight modes using momentary buttons. Each channel is assigned to a mode slot ((lowest channel = slot 1). The resulting modes for each slot X is defined by the COM_FLTMODEX parameters. The functionality can be used only if RC_MAP_FLTMODE is disabled. The maximum number of available slots and hence bits set in the mask is 6.

bitmask.description: Mask Channel 1 as a mode button
Mask Channel 2 as a mode button
Mask Channel 3 as a mode button
Mask Channel 4 as a mode button
Mask Channel 5 as a mode button
Mask Channel 6 as a mode button
Mask Channel 7 as a mode button
Mask Channel 8 as a mode button
Mask Channel 9 as a mode button
Mask Channel 10 as a mode button
Mask Channel 11 as a mode button
Mask Channel 12 as a mode button
Mask Channel 13 as a mode button
Mask Channel 14 as a mode button
Mask Channel 15 as a mode button
Mask Channel 16 as a mode button
Mask Channel 17 as a mode button
Mask Channel 18 as a mode button

parameters.name: RC_MAP_MODE_SW
parameters.longDesc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameters.name: RC_OFFB_TH
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_RETURN_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RC_TRANS_TH
parameters.shortDesc: Threshold for the VTOL transition switch
parameters.longDesc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameters.name: RTL_CONE_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Half-angle of the return mode altitude cone
parameters.longDesc: Defines the half-angle of a cone centered around the destination position that affects the altitude at which the vehicle returns.

values.description: No cone, always climb to RTL_RETURN_ALT above destination.
Only climb to at least RTL_DESCEND_ALT above destination.

parameters.name: RTL_DESCEND_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Descend to this altitude (above destination position) after return, and wait for time defined in RTL_LAND_DELAY. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed. VTOLs do transition to hover in this altitdue above the landing point.

parameters.name: RTL_HDG_MD
parameters.longDesc: Defines the heading behavior during RTL

parameters.name: RTL_LAND_DELAY
parameters.longDesc: Delay before landing (after initial descent) in Return mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at RTL_DESCEND_ALT.

parameters.name: RTL_LOITER_RAD
parameters.longDesc: Set the radius for loitering to a safe altitude for VTOL transition.

parameters.name: RTL_MIN_DIST
parameters.shortDesc: Horizontal radius from return point within which special rules for return mode apply
parameters.longDesc: The return altitude will be calculated based on RTL_CONE_ANG parameter. The yaw setpoint will switch to the one defined by corresponding waypoint.

parameters.name: RTL_PLD_MD
parameters.longDesc: Use precision landing when doing an RTL landing phase.

parameters.name: RTL_RETURN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Default minimum altitude above destination (e.g. home, safe point, landing pattern) for return flight. The vehicle will climb to this altitude when Return mode is enganged, unless it currently is flying higher already. This is affected by RTL_MIN_DIST and RTL_CONE_ANG.

parameters.name: RTL_TYPE
parameters.longDesc: Return mode destination and flight path (home location, rally point, mission landing pattern, reverse mission)

values.description: Return to closest safe point (home or rally point) via direct path.

Return to closest safe point other than home (mission landing pattern or rally point), via direct path. If no mission landing or rally points are defined return home via direct path. Always chose closest safe landing point if vehicle is a VTOL in hover mode.
Return to a planned mission landing, if available, using the mission path, else return to home via the reverse mission path. Do not consider rally points.
Return via direct path to closest destination: home, start of mission landing pattern or safe point. If the destination is a mission landing pattern, follow the pattern to land.

parameters.name: RTL_TIME_FACTOR
parameters.shortDesc: RTL time estimate safety margin factor
parameters.longDesc: Safety factor that is used to scale the actual RTL time estiamte. Time with margin = RTL_TIME_FACTOR * time + RTL_TIME_MARGIN

parameters.name: RTL_TIME_MARGIN
parameters.shortDesc: RTL time estimate safety margin offset
parameters.longDesc: Margin that is added to the time estimate, after it has already been scaled Time with margin = RTL_TIME_FACTOR * time + RTL_TIME_MARGIN

parameters.name: GND_L1_DAMPING
parameters.longDesc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameters.name: GND_L1_DIST
parameters.longDesc: This is the distance at which the next waypoint is activated. This should be set to about 2-4x of GND_WHEEL_BASE and not smaller than one meter (due to GPS accuracy).

parameters.name: GND_L1_PERIOD
parameters.longDesc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the rover it's following. Use values around 2-5m for a 0.3m wheel base. Tuning instructions: Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameters.name: GND_MAX_ANG
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum turn angle for Ackerman steering
parameters.longDesc: At a control output of 0, the steering wheels are at 0 radians. At a control output of 1, the steering wheels are at GND_MAX_ANG radians.

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_D
parameters.longDesc: This is the derivative gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_I
parameters.longDesc: This is the integral gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_IMAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maxim value the integral can reach to prevent wind-up.

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_P
parameters.longDesc: This is the proportional gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameters.name: GND_SPEED_THR_SC
parameters.longDesc: This is a gain to map the speed control output to the throttle linearly.

parameters.name: GND_SP_CTRL_MODE
parameters.longDesc: This allows the user to choose between closed loop gps speed or open loop cruise throttle speed

values.description: close the loop with gps speed

parameters.name: GND_THR_CRUISE
parameters.longDesc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. 10% is ok for a traxxas stampede vxl with ESC set to training mode

parameters.name: GND_THR_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For a Traxxas stampede vxl with the ESC set to training, 30 % is enough

parameters.name: GND_THR_MIN
parameters.longDesc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. Set to 0 for rover

parameters.name: GND_WHEEL_BASE
parameters.shortDesc: Distance from front axle to rear axle
parameters.longDesc: A value of 0.31 is typical for 1/10 RC cars.

parameters.name: RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL
parameters.shortDesc: Min airspeed scaling factor for takeoff
parameters.longDesc: Pitch up will be commanded when the following airspeed is reached: FW_AIRSPD_MIN * RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL

parameters.name: RWTO_HDG
parameters.shortDesc: Specifies which heading should be held during the runway takeoff ground roll
parameters.longDesc: 0: airframe heading when takeoff is initiated 1: position control along runway direction (bearing defined from vehicle position on takeoff initiation to MAV_CMD_TAKEOFF position defined by operator)

parameters.name: RWTO_L1_PERIOD
parameters.shortDesc: L1 period while steering on runway

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: Fixed-wing settings are used if set to 0. Note that there is also a minimum pitch of 10 degrees during takeoff, so this must be larger if set.

parameters.name: RWTO_MAX_THR
parameters.longDesc: Can be used to test taxi on runway

parameters.name: RWTO_NUDGE
parameters.shortDesc: Enable use of yaw stick for nudging the wheel during runway ground roll
parameters.longDesc: This is useful when map, GNSS, or yaw errors on ground are misaligned with what the operator intends for takeoff course. Particularly useful for skinny runways or if the wheel servo is a bit off trim.

parameters.name: RWTO_PSP
parameters.shortDesc: Pitch setpoint during taxi / before takeoff airspeed is reached
parameters.longDesc: A taildragger with steerable wheel might need to pitch up a little to keep its wheel on the ground before airspeed to takeoff is reached.

parameters.name: RWTO_RAMP_TIME
parameters.shortDesc: Throttle ramp up time for runway takeoff

parameters.name: SDLOG_ALGORITHM
parameters.longDesc: Selects the algorithm used for logfile encryption

parameters.name: SDLOG_BOOT_BAT
parameters.longDesc: When enabled, logging will not start from boot if battery power is not detected (e.g. powered via USB on a test bench). This prevents extraneous flight logs from being created during bench testing. Note that this only applies to log-from-boot modes. This has no effect on arm-based modes.

parameters.name: SDLOG_DIRS_MAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum number of log directories to keep
parameters.longDesc: If there are more log directories than this value, the system will delete the oldest directories during startup. In addition, the system will delete old logs if there is not enough free space left. The minimum amount is 300 MB. If this is set to 0, old directories will only be removed if the free space falls below the minimum. Note: this does not apply to mission log files.

parameters.name: SDLOG_EXCH_KEY
parameters.longDesc: If the logfile is encrypted using a symmetric key algorithm, the used encryption key is generated at logging start and stored on the sdcard RSA2048 encrypted using this key.

parameters.name: SDLOG_KEY
parameters.longDesc: Selects the key in keystore, used for encrypting the log. When using a symmetric encryption algorithm, the key is generated at logging start and kept stored in this index. For symmetric algorithms, the key is volatile and valid only for the duration of logging. The key is stored in encrypted format on the sdcard alongside the logfile, using an RSA2048 key defined by the SDLOG_EXCHANGE_KEY

parameters.name: SDLOG_MISSION
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, a small additional "mission" log file will be written to the SD card. The log contains just those messages that are useful for tasks like generating flight statistics and geotagging. The different modes can be used to further reduce the logged data (and thus the log file size). For example, choose geotagging mode to only log data required for geotagging. Note that the normal/full log is still created, and contains all the data in the mission log (and more).

parameters.name: SDLOG_MODE
parameters.longDesc: Determines when to start and stop logging. By default, logging is started when arming the system, and stopped when disarming.

parameters.name: SDLOG_PROFILE
parameters.longDesc: This integer bitmask controls the set and rates of logged topics. The default allows for general log analysis while keeping the log file size reasonably small. Enabling multiple sets leads to higher bandwidth requirements and larger log files. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Default set (used for general log analysis) 1 : Full rate estimator (EKF2) replay topics 2 : Topics for thermal calibration (high rate raw IMU and Baro sensor data) 3 : Topics for system identification (high rate actuator control and IMU data) 4 : Full rates for analysis of fast maneuvers (RC, attitude, rates and actuators) 5 : Debugging topics (debug_*.msg topics, for custom code) 6 : Topics for sensor comparison (low rate raw IMU, Baro and Magnetomer data) 7 : Topics for computer vision and collision avoidance 8 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Gyro) 9 : Raw FIFO high-rate IMU (Accel) 10: Logging of mavlink tunnel message (useful for payload communication debugging)

parameters.name: SDLOG_UTC_OFFSET
parameters.longDesc: the difference in hours and minutes from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for a your place and date. for example, In case of South Korea(UTC+09:00), UTC offset is 540 min (9*60) refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_time_offsets

parameters.name: SDLOG_UUID
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1, add an ID to the log, which uniquely identifies the vehicle

parameters.name: SIM_BAT_MIN_PCT
parameters.longDesc: Can be used to alter the battery level during SITL- or HITL-simulation on the fly. Particularly useful for testing different low-battery behaviour.

parameters.name: CAL_ACC0_ID
parameters.longDesc: Device ID of the accelerometer this calibration applies to.

parameters.name: CAL_ACC0_ROT
parameters.longDesc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameters.name: CAL_ACC1_ROT

parameters.name: CAL_BARO1_ID
parameters.longDesc: Device ID of the barometer this calibration applies to.

parameters.name: CAL_BARO2_ID
parameters.longDesc: Device ID of the barometer this calibration applies to.

parameters.name: CAL_BARO3_ID

parameters.name: CAL_GYRO0_ROT

parameters.longDesc: Device ID of the gyroscope this calibration applies to.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_ID

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_ROT
parameters.longDesc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_XCOMP
parameters.longDesc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_XODIAG
parameters.shortDesc: Magnetometer 0 X-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_YCOMP
parameters.longDesc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_YODIAG

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_ZCOMP
parameters.longDesc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG0_ZODIAG

parameters.longDesc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.longDesc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameters.name: CAL_MAG3_ZODIAG
parameters.shortDesc: Magnetometer 3 Z-axis off diagonal scale factor

parameters.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameters.longDesc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameters.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameters.longDesc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXR
parameters.shortDesc: Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor
parameters.longDesc: Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground is less than 50% of this value.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_MINHGT
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.

parameters.name: CAL_AIR_CMODEL
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed sensor compensation model for the SDP3x
parameters.longDesc: Model with Pitot CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Model without Pitot (1.5 mm tubes) CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Tube Pressure Drop CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Diameter in mm of the pitot and tubes, must have the same diameter. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor and the static + dynamic port length of the pitot.

parameters.name: CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation

parameters.name: CAL_AIR_TUBELEN
parameters.longDesc: See the CAL_AIR_CMODEL explanation on how this parameter should be set.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG_ROT_AUTO
parameters.longDesc: During calibration attempt to automatically determine the rotation of external magnetometers.

parameters.name: CAL_MAG_SIDES
parameters.shortDesc: Bitfield selecting mag sides for calibration
parameters.longDesc: If set to two side calibration, only the offsets are estimated, the scale calibration is left unchanged. Thus an initial six side calibration is recommended. Bits: ORIENTATION_TAIL_DOWN = 1 ORIENTATION_NOSE_DOWN = 2 ORIENTATION_LEFT = 4 ORIENTATION_RIGHT = 8 ORIENTATION_UPSIDE_DOWN = 16 ORIENTATION_RIGHTSIDE_UP = 32

parameters.name: IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF
parameters.shortDesc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for accel
parameters.longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary accelerometer. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF
parameters.shortDesc: Cutoff frequency for angular acceleration (D-Term filter)
parameters.longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter used on the time derivative of the measured angular velocity, also known as the D-term filter in the rate controller. The D-term uses the derivative of the rate and thus is the most susceptible to noise. Therefore, using a D-term filter allows to increase IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF, which leads to reduced control latency and permits to increase the P gains. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF
parameters.shortDesc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for gyro
parameters.longDesc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary gyro. This only affects the angular velocity sent to the controllers, not the estimators. It applies also to the angular acceleration (D-Term filter), see IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_BW
parameters.shortDesc: IMU gyro ESC notch filter bandwidth
parameters.longDesc: Bandwidth per notch filter when using dynamic notch filtering with ESC RPM.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_EN
parameters.longDesc: Enable bank of dynamically updating notch filters. Requires ESC RPM feedback or onboard FFT (IMU_GYRO_FFT_EN).

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_HMC
parameters.shortDesc: IMU gyro dynamic notch filter harmonics
parameters.longDesc: ESC RPM number of harmonics (multiples of RPM) for ESC RPM dynamic notch filtering.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_NF0_BW
parameters.longDesc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF0_FRQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_NF0_FRQ
parameters.longDesc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF0_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_NF1_BW
parameters.longDesc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF1_FRQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_NF1_FRQ
parameters.longDesc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF1_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameters.name: IMU_GYRO_RATEMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Gyro control data maximum publication rate (inner loop rate)
parameters.longDesc: The maximum rate the gyro control data (vehicle_angular_velocity) will be allowed to publish at. This is the loop rate for the rate controller and outputs. Note: sensor data is always read and filtered at the full raw rate (eg commonly 8 kHz) regardless of this setting.

parameters.name: IMU_INTEG_RATE
parameters.longDesc: The rate at which raw IMU data is integrated to produce delta angles and delta velocities. Recommended to set this to a multiple of the estimator update period (currently 10 ms for ekf2).

parameters.name: SENS_BARO_RATE
parameters.longDesc: Barometric air data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual barometric data rate is still dependent on the sensor.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameters.name: SENS_EXT_I2C_PRB
parameters.longDesc: Probe for optional external I2C devices.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_RATE
parameters.longDesc: Optical flow data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual optical flow data rate is still dependent on the sensor.

parameters.name: SENS_FLOW_ROT
parameters.longDesc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the optical flow relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle.

parameters.name: SENS_GPS_MASK
parameters.longDesc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy

parameters.name: SENS_GPS_PRIME
parameters.longDesc: When no blending is active, this defines the preferred GPS receiver instance. The GPS selection logic waits until the primary receiver is available to send data to the EKF even if a secondary instance is already available. The secondary instance is then only used if the primary one times out. To have an equal priority of all the instances, set this parameter to -1 and the best receiver will be used. This parameter has no effect if blending is active.

parameters.name: SENS_GPS_TAU
parameters.longDesc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.

parameters.name: SENS_IMU_AUTOCAL
parameters.longDesc: Automatically initialize IMU (accel/gyro) calibration from bias estimates if available.

parameters.name: SENS_INT_BARO_EN
parameters.longDesc: For systems with an external barometer, this should be set to false to make sure that the external is used.

parameters.name: SENS_MAG_AUTOCAL
parameters.longDesc: Automatically initialize magnetometer calibration from bias estimate if available.

parameters.name: SENS_MAG_RATE
parameters.longDesc: Magnetometer data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual magnetometer data rate is still dependent on the sensor.

parameters.name: SIH_DISTSNSR_OVR
parameters.shortDesc: if >= 0 the distance sensor measures will be overridden by this value
parameters.longDesc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable distance sensor

parameters.name: SIH_IXX
parameters.longDesc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameters.name: SIH_IXY
parameters.longDesc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameters.name: SIH_IXZ
parameters.longDesc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameters.name: SIH_IYY
parameters.longDesc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameters.name: SIH_IYZ
parameters.longDesc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameters.name: SIH_IZZ
parameters.longDesc: The inertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameters.name: SIH_KDV
parameters.longDesc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules. The greater this value, the slower the quad will move. Drag force function of velocity: D=-KDV*V. The maximum freefall velocity can be computed as V=10*MASS/KDV [m/s]

parameters.name: SIH_KDW
parameters.longDesc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules during rotations. The greater this value, the slower the quad will rotate. Aerodynamic moment function of body rate: Ma=-KDW*W_B. This value can be set to 0 if unknown.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_H0
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the Above Mean Sea Level (AMSL) altitude where the simulation begins. If using FlightGear as a visual animation, this value can be tweaked such that the vehicle lies on the ground at takeoff. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_LAT0
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the North-South location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_LOC_LON0
parameters.longDesc: This value represents the East-West location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameters.name: SIH_L_PITCH
parameters.longDesc: This is the arm length generating the pitching moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the front and rear motors.

parameters.name: SIH_L_ROLL
parameters.longDesc: This is the arm length generating the rolling moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the left and right motors.

parameters.name: SIH_MASS
parameters.longDesc: This value can be measured by weighting the quad on a scale.

parameters.name: SIH_Q_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum torque delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about few percent of the maximum thrust force.

parameters.name: SIH_T_MAX
parameters.longDesc: This is the maximum force delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about 5 times the mass of the quadrotor.

parameters.name: SIH_T_TAU
parameters.longDesc: the time taken for the thruster to step from 0 to 100% should be about 4 times tau

parameters.name: SIM_GPS_USED
parameters.shortDesc: simulated GPS number of satellites used

parameters.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameters.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameters.longDesc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameters.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameters.shortDesc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameters.longDesc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameters.shortDesc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temperature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameters.shortDesc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameters.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameters.longDesc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameters.name: SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE
parameters.longDesc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.

parameters.name: SYS_FAILURE_EN
parameters.longDesc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_GPS
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a GPS
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the system has no GPS. If disabled, the sensors hub will not process sensor_gps, and GPS will not be available for the rest of the system.

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameters.shortDesc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameters.longDesc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.

parameters.name: SYS_HAS_NUM_DIST
parameters.shortDesc: Control the number of distance sensors on the vehicle
parameters.longDesc: If set to the number of distance sensors, the preflight check will check for their presence and valid data publication. Disable with 0 if no distance sensor present or to disable the preflight check.

parameters.name: SYS_HITL
parameters.shortDesc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameters.longDesc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameters.name: SYS_MC_EST_GROUP
parameters.longDesc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs

parameters.name: SYS_RGB_MAXBRT
parameters.longDesc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for maximum brightness

parameters.name: TC_A0_ID
parameters.shortDesc: ID of Accelerometer that the calibration is for

parameters.name: TC_A0_X0_0
parameters.shortDesc: Accelerometer offset temperature ^0 polynomial coefficient - X axis

parameters.name: TC_A0_X0_1

parameters.name: TC_G_ENABLE
parameters.shortDesc: Thermal compensation for rate gyro sensors

parameters.name: VT_ARSP_BLEND
parameters.longDesc: Airspeed at which we can start blending both fw and mc controls. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: VT_ARSP_TRANS
parameters.longDesc: Airspeed at which we can switch to fw mode

parameters.name: VT_B_DEC_FF
parameters.shortDesc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch feedforward gain

parameters.name: VT_B_DEC_I
parameters.shortDesc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch I gain

parameters.name: VT_B_DEC_MSS
parameters.longDesc: The approximate deceleration during a back transition in m/s/s Used to calculate back transition distance in mission mode. A lower value will make the VTOL transition further from the destination waypoint. For standard vtol and tiltrotors a controller is used to track this value during the transition.

parameters.name: VT_B_REV_DEL
parameters.shortDesc: Delay in seconds before applying back transition throttle
parameters.longDesc: Set this to a value greater than 0 to give the motor time to spin down. unit s

parameters.name: VT_B_REV_OUT
parameters.shortDesc: Output on airbrakes channel during back transition
parameters.longDesc: Used for airbrakes or with ESCs that have reverse thrust enabled on a separate channel. Airbrakes need to be enabled for your selected model/mixer.

parameters.name: VT_B_TRANS_DUR
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds used for a back transition

parameters.name: VT_B_TRANS_RAMP
parameters.shortDesc: Back transition MC motor ramp up time
parameters.longDesc: This sets the duration during which the MC motors ramp up to the commanded thrust during the back transition stage.

parameters.name: VT_B_TRANS_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Target throttle value for the transition to hover flight
parameters.longDesc: standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle Note for standard vtol: For ESCs and mixers that support reverse thrust on low PWM values set this to a negative value to apply active breaking For ESCs that support thrust reversal with a control channel please set VT_B_REV_OUT and set this to a positive value to apply active breaking

parameters.name: VT_ELEV_MC_LOCK
parameters.longDesc: If set to 1 the control surfaces are locked at the disarmed value in multicopter mode.

parameters.name: VT_FWD_THRUST_EN
parameters.shortDesc: Enable/disable usage of fixed-wing actuators in hover to generate forward force (instead of pitching down)
parameters.longDesc: This technique can be used to avoid the plane having to pitch down in order to move forward. This prevents large, negative lift values being created when facing strong winds. Fixed-wing forward actuators refers to puller/pusher (standard VTOL), or forward-tilt (tiltrotor VTOL). Only active if demaded down pitch is below VT_PITCH_MIN, and uses VT_FWD_THRUST_SC to get from demanded down pitch to fixed-wing actuation.

values.description: Disable FW forward actuation in hover.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes (except LANDING).
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1 (except LANDING).
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2 (except LANDING).

parameters.name: VT_FWD_THRUST_SC
parameters.shortDesc: Fixed-wing actuator thrust scale for hover forward flight
parameters.longDesc: Scale applied to the demanded down-pitch to get the fixed-wing forward actuation in hover mode. Only active if demaded down pitch is below VT_PITCH_MIN. Enabled via VT_FWD_THRUST_EN.

parameters.name: VT_FW_ALT_ERR
parameters.longDesc: Maximum negative altitude error for fixed wing flight. If the altitude drops below this value below the altitude setpoint the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL.

parameters.name: VT_FW_DIFTHR_EN
parameters.longDesc: Set to 1 to enable differential thrust in fixed-wing flight.

parameters.name: VT_FW_DIFTHR_SC
parameters.longDesc: This factor specifies how the yaw input gets mapped to differential thrust in forwards flight.

parameters.name: VT_FW_MIN_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Minimum altitude for fixed wing flight, when in fixed wing the altitude drops below this altitude the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameters.name: VT_FW_QC_P
parameters.longDesc: Maximum pitch angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameters.name: VT_FW_QC_R
parameters.longDesc: Maximum roll angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameters.name: VT_F_TRANS_DUR
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds used for a transition

parameters.name: VT_F_TRANS_THR
parameters.shortDesc: Target throttle value for the transition to fixed wing flight
parameters.longDesc: standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle

parameters.name: VT_F_TR_OL_TM
parameters.shortDesc: Airspeed less front transition time (open loop)
parameters.longDesc: The duration of the front transition when there is no airspeed feedback available.

parameters.name: VT_LND_PITCH_MIN
parameters.shortDesc: Minimum pitch angle during hover landing
parameters.longDesc: Overrides  VT_PITCH_MIN when the vehicle is in LAND mode (hovering). During landing it can be beneficial to allow lower minimum pitch angles as it can avoid the wings generating too much lift and preventing the vehicle from sinking at the desired rate.

parameters.name: VT_PITCH_MIN
parameters.longDesc: Minimum pitch angle during hover flight. If the desired pitch angle is is lower than this value then the fixed-wing forward actuation can be used to compensate for the missing thrust in forward direction (see VT_FW_TRHUST_EN)

parameters.name: VT_PSHER_RMP_DT
parameters.longDesc: Defines the time window during which the pusher throttle will be ramped up linearly to VT_F_TRANS_THR during a transition to fixed wing mode. Zero or negative values will produce an instant throttle rise to VT_F_TRANS_THR.

parameters.name: VT_TILT_FW
parameters.shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in fw mode

parameters.name: VT_TILT_MC
parameters.shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in mc mode

parameters.name: VT_TILT_SPINUP
parameters.shortDesc: Tilt actuator control value commanded when disarmed and during the first second after arming
parameters.longDesc: This specific tilt during spin-up is necessary for some systems whose motors otherwise don't spin-up freely.

parameters.name: VT_TILT_TRANS
parameters.shortDesc: Position of tilt servo in transition mode

parameters.name: VT_TRANS_MIN_TM
parameters.longDesc: Minimum time in seconds for front transition.

parameters.name: VT_TRANS_P2_DUR
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds it should take for the rotors to rotate forward completely from the point when the plane has picked up enough airspeed and is ready to go into fixed wind mode.

parameters.name: VT_TRANS_TIMEOUT
parameters.longDesc: Time in seconds after which transition will be cancelled. Disabled if set to 0.

parameters.name: WV_GAIN
parameters.longDesc: The desired gain to convert roll sp into yaw rate sp.

parameters.name: VTO_LOITER_ALT
parameters.longDesc: Altitude relative to home at which vehicle will loiter after front transition.

parameters.name: MPC_LAND_RC_HELP
parameters.shortDesc: Enable user assisted descent speed for autonomous land routine
parameters.longDesc: When enabled, descent speed will be: stick full up - 0 stick centered - MPC_LAND_SPEED stick full down - 2 * MPC_LAND_SPEED

values.description: skip the controller and feedthrough the setpoints
